item.title: Salesforce Operations Specialist (Remote, Americas)
item.description:
About the role

As Operations Specialist you’ll become an expert in the health and quality of the tools Shopify employees use to empower valuable conversations with our merchants. You will help resolve issues and provide teams with analysis, bug reports, and suggested improvements. The ideal candidate is passionate about solving problems, has experience providing operational support to a sales and service organization on the Salesforce platform, serving as a key point of contact as it relates to our sales & marketing product line.

You\'ll get to do things like: 

  • Be the main point of contact for operational questions received from user base; triage where required

  • Perform regular health checks for optimization, accuracy, and security

  • Work collaboratively with business stakeholders and Salesforce Operations and development team to support the needs of our internal customers/users

  • Track tool(s) license assignments/usage month over month, service disruptions/downtime

  • Analyze tools usage and performance, using these insights to report on and improve product performance

  • Manage a solid understanding of sales & service operations and Salesforce platform technology

  • Troubleshoot and escalate issues as necessary, championing them through to completion

Qualifications

  • Hold operational knowledge of SFDC platform, case queue and 3rd party tools

  • Hands on experience working on Salesforce.com Platform; Sales & Service Clouds
  • Strong sales & service operational knowledge and problem solving skills

  • Proven success building relationships across all levels

  • A solid base of experience in technology solutions, integrations, Saas, service centre, or sales operations

  • A willingness to learn in a fast paced environment with a can do, hands on attitude to get the job done

  • Proven track record to see problems through to resolution

  • Be comfortable with ambiguity & working in a fast paced environment

  • A willingness to look at a problem from all angles; be curious

We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. We are looking forward to reading your application!

At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.

Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.

At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

How we hire

At Shopify, we put a lot of care and time into who we hire. We believe that in order to build the best products, we need to build high impact teams. Our recruitment process centres around what we call the Life Story interview, a conversational-style interview where we get to learn more about you.

item.title: Senior Data Engineer (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Our Data Engineering group builds and maintains the platform that delivers accessible data to power decision-making at Shopify for millions of merchants. We’re hiring high-impact developers across teams:

  • The Engine group organizes all merchant and Shopify data into our data lake in highly-optimized formats for fast query processing, and maintaining the security + quality of our datasets.
  • The Analytics group builds products that leverage the Engine primitives to deliver simple and useful products that power scalable transformation of data at Shopify in batch, or streaming, or for machine learning. This group is focused on making it really simple for our users to answer three questions: What happened in the past? What is happening now? And, what will happen in the future?  
  • The Data Experiences group builds end-user experiences for experimentation, data discovery, and business intelligence reporting.
  • The Reliability group operates the data platform efficiently in a consistent and reliable manner. They build tools for other teams at Data Platform to leverage to encourage consistency and they champion reliability across the platform.

Qualifications

While our teams value specialized skills, they\'ve also got a lot in common. We\'re looking for a(n): 

  • High-energy self-starter with experience and passion for data and big data scale processing. You enjoy working in fast-paced environments and love making an impact. 
  • Exceptional communicator with the ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand language for our stakeholders. 
  • Excitement for working with a remote team; you value collaborating on problems, asking questions, delivering feedback, and supporting others in their goals whether they are in your vicinity or entire cities apart.
  • Solid software engineer: experienced in building and maintaining systems at scale.

A Senior Data Developer at Shopify typically has 4-6 years of experience in one or more of the following areas:

  • Working with the internals of a distributed compute engine (Spark, Presto, DBT, or Flink/Beam)
  • Query optimization, resource allocation and management, and data lake performance (Presto, SQL)
  • Cloud infrastructure (Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Terraform)
  • Security products and methods (Apache Ranger, Apache Knox, OAuth, IAM, Kerberos)
  • Deploying and scaling ML solutions using open-source frameworks (MLFlow, TFX, H2O, etc.)
  • Building full-stack applications (Ruby/Rails, React, TypeScript)
  • Background and practical experience in statistics and/or computational mathematics (Bayesian and Frequentist approaches, NumPy, PyMC3, etc.)
  • Modern Big-Data storage technologies (Iceberg, Hudi, Delta)




    #Senior Software Developer- Distributed Systems #Senior Software Developer- Data Engineering #Senior Data App Developer #Senior Data Reliability Engineer #Senior Software Developer- Reliability

As there are multiple positions, this posting will remain live until all positions have been filled. Successful candidates can expect to hear back from us within 2 weeks of application.

#LI-REMOTE 

Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.

At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

item.title: Data Science Manager (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Data is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. 

We are looking for Data Science Managers to join our Data Science teams and help shape the insights and algorithms that will inform our strategies as we grow globally.  

What your role will look like:

  • Partner closely with product, engineering and other RnD stakeholders to guide their decisions using data

  • Proactively identify and champion projects that solve complex problems across multiple domains

  • Apply specialized skills and fundamental data science methods (e.g. experimental design, recommender systems and machine learning when needed) to inform improvements to our business

  • Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines: work closely with stakeholders to build  models, tables or schemas that support business processes

  • Empower teams to build and maintain actionable KPIs, production-quality dashboards, informative deep dives, and scalable data products

 

Qualifications

You will need to have:

  • 7-10 years of commercial experience as in a data science role solving high impact business problems, including 3+ years leading and maintaining high performance data science teams
  • Experience building and managing high performance data science teams
  • Experience delivering business impact through analysis and data products
  • Experience building data pipelines and driving ETL design decisions
  • Technical leadership and management experience (you enjoy doing both).  You can jump into the code to the level that your direct reports admire and respect, but are also interested in developing people and capacity for your team
  • Experience creating data product strategies, shipping data products, iterating after launch, and trying again
  • Extensive experience using Python including a strong grasp of object oriented programming (OOP) fundamentals
  • Strong ability to prioritize and communicate to technical and non-technical audiences alike

It would be great if you have:

  • Previous experience using Spark (either via Scala or Pyspark)
  • Experience with statistical methods like regression, GLMs or experiment design and analysis, shipping productionized machine learning systems or other advanced techniques are also welcome
  • Experience with data storytelling using Tableau, QlikView, Mode, Matplotlib, D3, or similar data visualization tools

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce at Shopify, click the “Apply Now” button to submit your application. Please submit a resume and cover letter with your application. Make sure to tell us how you think you can make an impact at Shopify, and what drew you to the role. 

As there are multiple positions, this posting will remain live until all positions have been filled. Successful candidates can expect to hear back from us within 2 weeks of application.
 

#LI-REMOTE

Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.

At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

How we hire

At Shopify, we put a lot of care and time into who we hire. We believe that in order to build the best products, we need to build high impact teams. Our recruitment process centres around what we call the Life Story interview, a conversational-style interview where we get to learn more about you.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist - SHOP (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

We\'re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team as we turn Shop into one of the most beloved products and brands in the world. We want shoppers to be able to develop meaningful connections with the brands they love, and we believe that Shop is the answer to helping foster those relationships with the powerhouse of Shopify merchants we love and support.

Data is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. 

Our Data Scientists focus on pushing products and the business forward, with a focus on solving important problems rather than specific tools. We are looking for talented data scientists to help us better understand our merchants and buyers so we can help them on their journey.

Your responsibilities:

  • Proactively identify and champion projects that solve complex problems across multiple domains

  • Partner closely with product, engineering and other business leaders to influence product and program decisions with data

  • Apply specialized skills and fundamental data science methods (e.g. regression, survival analysis, segmentation, experimentation, and machine learning when needed) to inform improvements to our business

  • Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines: work closely with stakeholders to build instrumentation and define dimensional models, tables or schemas  that support business processes

  • Build actionable KPIs, production-quality dashboards, informative deep dives, and scalable data products

  • Influence leadership to drive more data-informed decisions

  • Define and advance best practices within data science and product teams

 

Qualifications

You will need to have:

  • 4-6 years of commercial experience as a Data Scientist ​​​​​​solving high impact business problems

  • Extensive experience with Python and software engineering fundamentals

  • Experience with applied statistics and quantitative modelling (e.g. regression, survival analysis, segmentation, experimentation, and machine learning when needed)

  • Demonstrated ability to translate analytical insights into clear recommendations and effectively communicate them to technical and non-technical stakeholders

  • Curiosity about the problem domain and an analytical approach

  • Strong sense of ownership and growth mindset

It would be nice if you have:

  • Deep understanding of advanced SQL techniques

  • Expertise with statistical techniques and their applications in business

  • Masterful data storytelling and strategic thinking

  • Deep understanding of dimensional modelling and scaling ETL pipelines

  • Experience launching productionized machine learning models at scale

  • Extensive domain experience in e-commerce, marketing or SaaS

 

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We know that looking for a new role can be both exciting and time-consuming, and we truly appreciate your effort.  We want to know what you\'re really interested in building and why you want to build it at Shop, so please give us as much detail on this as you\'d like in the answers on the next page. 👍 📖

As there are multiple positions, this posting will remain live until all positions have been filled. Successful candidates can expect to hear back from us within 2 weeks of application.

#LI-REMOTE 

Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.

At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

How we hire

At Shopify, we put a lot of care and time into who we hire. We believe that in order to build the best products, we need to build high impact teams. Our recruitment process centres around what we call the Life Story interview, a conversational-style interview where we get to learn more about you.

item.title: Data Development Manager (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Our Data Engineering group builds and maintains the platform that delivers accessible data to power decision-making at Shopify for millions of merchants. We’re hiring high-impact developers across teams:

  • The Engine group organizes all merchant and Shopify data into our data lake in highly-optimized formats for fast query processing, and maintaining the security and quality of our datasets.

  • The Analytics group leverages the Engine primitives to build and deliver simple and useful products that power scalable transformation of data at Shopify in batch, streaming, or for machine learning. This group is focused on making it really simple for our users to answer three questions: What happened in the past? What is happening now? And, what will happen in the future?  

  • The Data Experiences group builds end-user experiences for experimentation, data discovery, and business intelligence reporting.

  • The Reliability group operates the data platform in a consistent and reliable manner. They build tools for other teams on Data Platform to leverage and encourage consistency as they champion reliability across the platform.

Your role:

  • Providing people and technical leadership within your team to support the mission of the Data Platform Engineering group. 

  • Working closely with a cross-functional team of product leaders, engineering leaders, and distributed system engineers to influence the organizational vision and help solve hard problems in scaling the data platform.

  • Strategic and tactical deliverables for your team.

  • Deploying the team towards data platform priorities, achieving measurable impact and outcomes.

  • Defining and executing on your team’s deliverables.

  • Sourcing and hiring for positions in your team or organization.

  • All aspects of performance management, including compensation, performance improvement plans, promotions, and separations.

Qualifications

About You:

  • An experienced manager of teams of high-performing engineers.

  • Technical engineering background in one or more areas listed in the next section.

  • A proven track record of delivering impactful results.

  • Exceptional communication skills and ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand language for our stakeholders. 

  • Excitement for working with a remote team; you value collaborating on problems, asking questions, delivering feedback, and supporting others in their goals whether they are in your vicinity or entire cities apart.

A Data Development Manager at Shopify would typically have at least 2 years of experience leading high-functioning teams, and expertise in one or more of the following areas:

  • Experience with the internals of a distributed compute engine (Spark, Presto, DBT, or Flink/Beam)

  • Experience in query optimization, resource allocation and management, and data lake performance (Presto, SQL)

  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Terraform)
    Experience with security products and methods (Apache Ranger, Apache Knox, OAuth, IAM, Kerberos)

  • Experience deploying and scaling ML solutions using open-source frameworks (MLFlow, TFX, H2O, etc.)

  • Experience building full-stack applications (Ruby/Rails, React, TypeScript)

  • Background and practical experience in statistics and/or computational mathematics (Bayesian and Frequentist approaches, NumPy, PyMC3, etc.)

  • Modern Big-Data storage technologies (Iceberg, Hudi, Delta)

As there are multiple positions, this posting will remain live until all positions have been filled. Successful candidates can expect to hear back from us within 2 weeks of application.

#LI-REMOTE

Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.

item.title: Customer Engineer, Data Analytics, Public Sector
item.description:
2022-05-23T21:32:01.259Z

Customer Engineer, Data Analytics, Public Sector

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role.
  • Experience with cloud computing (e.g., cloud market) and delivering technical presentations.
  • Experience with analytic warehouse solutions, “Big Data” technologies, real time streaming, performance, and scalability optimizations.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree in Computer Science or related technical field.
  • Technical sales experience in the fields of cloud computing, data, information lifecycle management, and Big Data.
  • Experience in writing code in a common development languages such as Java, Python, JavaScript, C++, Scala, R, or Go.
  • Experience with developing data warehousing, data lakes, batch, or real-time event processing and exact transform and load (ETL) workflows solutions (e.g., Informatica, Talend, Alooma, SAP, Data Services).
  • Knowledge of Linux and an ability to address domain name systems, transmission control protocol, firewalls, proxy servers, load balancing, virtual private network, and virtual private cloud.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Customer Engineer, you will work with the Sales team to introduce Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective and existing customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and problem-solve any potential roadblocks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections, and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
  • Manage the technical relationship with Google’s customers (e.g., managing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources).
  • Work with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations in customer and partner environments.
  • Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight the Google Cloud Platform value proposition, using techniques that include presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, and request for information response documents.
  • Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other events.

Location

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

item.title: Customer Engineer, Data Analytics, Public Sector
item.description:
2022-05-23T21:32:01.259Z

Customer Engineer, Data Analytics, Public Sector

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role.
  • Experience with cloud computing (e.g., cloud market) and delivering technical presentations.
  • Experience with analytic warehouse solutions, “Big Data” technologies, real time streaming, performance, and scalability optimizations.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree in Computer Science or related technical field.
  • Technical sales experience in the fields of cloud computing, data, information lifecycle management, and Big Data.
  • Experience in writing code in a common development languages such as Java, Python, JavaScript, C++, Scala, R, or Go.
  • Experience with developing data warehousing, data lakes, batch, or real-time event processing and exact transform and load (ETL) workflows solutions (e.g., Informatica, Talend, Alooma, SAP, Data Services).
  • Knowledge of Linux and an ability to address domain name systems, transmission control protocol, firewalls, proxy servers, load balancing, virtual private network, and virtual private cloud.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Customer Engineer, you will work with the Sales team to introduce Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective and existing customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and problem-solve any potential roadblocks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections, and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
  • Manage the technical relationship with Google’s customers (e.g., managing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources).
  • Work with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations in customer and partner environments.
  • Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight the Google Cloud Platform value proposition, using techniques that include presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, and request for information response documents.
  • Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other events.

Location

item.title: Video Measurement Lead, Large Customer Sales
item.description:
2022-05-10T19:02:40.986Z

Video Measurement Lead, Large Customer Sales

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in digital media/advertising analytics, or analytics in a consultative position.
  • Experience working with data sets by translating insights into actionable strategies.
  • Experience working within SQL.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with dashboard creation via data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Datastudio etc.).
  • Experience with marketing analytics, return on investment/financial modeling, creative testing, Brand Health Tracking, and statistical analysis.
  • Experience in marshaling data sets and creating data narratives via historical analysis and market trends.
  • Experience with and an understanding of advanced statistical modeling and quantitative analysis techniques (e.g., MMM, MTA, propensity modeling, cluster analysis, etc.) using languages such as Python or R.
  • Ability to understand partners’ strategic background and objectives.

About the job

The Brand Acceleration Team (BAT) is made up of Brand Strategists, Measurement Experts, and Insights Specialists with expertise across brand building, creative, media, and measurement. Our goal is to educate, inspire, and strategize the best possible ways to build a client\'s brand using the power of sight, sound, and motion (e.g., ahem, video).

As a Video Measurement Lead, you will play a critical role in helping customers drive business growth through YouTube. You will be responsible for assessing video measurement needs across clients, conducting meta analyses to develop best practices, and crafting measurement plans/playbooks for execution by client teams.You will coordinate with the Brand Activation Team, conducting internal and external research projects, analyzing data from different sources, and formulating clear insights and impactful recommendations that drive our clients’ businesses forward. You will be a thought leader for how YouTube approaches Video campaign optimization/measurement at scale, and support with adapted strategies and new capabilities building client’s Video Measurement Maturity at scale. In partnership with stakeholders, the Video Measurement Lead will develop compelling narratives and recommendations to share insights with clients and the industry.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Act as the subject matter expert on Google and YouTube data to measure and drive growth of video as a medium to deliver customer objectives across upper and low funnel media goals. 
  • Ensure a smooth execution of Brand Activation Team Video measurement plans, conducting scaled meta analyses across Campaign Reach/Frequency goals, Campaign Creative Effectiveness, Brand Health tracking, and Brand Lift studies in order to develop industry level learnings to get the best out of YouTube to build and drive a brand. 
  • Analyze proprietary data, leverage various modeling techniques to solve video/brand challenges, uncover opportunities to build solutions/new capabilities, and develop playbooks for client teams to activate at scale. 
  • Coordinate plans/playbooks with Analytical Leads to establish Video Measurement practices, advise on methodologies, campaign key performance indicators and provide guidance on measurement plans.

Location

item.title: Research Intern, MS, Fall 2022
item.description:
2022-04-18T14:02:04.015Z

Research Intern, MS, Fall 2022

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
  • + 1 more location
Apply

Please complete your application before August 26th, 2022. Participation in the internship program requires that you are located in Canada for the duration of the internship program.

NOTE: This internship is intended for students who are pursuing a MS degree with an anticipated graduation date before December 2023, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating after December 2023, we encourage you to apply to the Student Researcher opening.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume.


Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Waterloo, ON, Canada; Toronto, ON, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a Master\'s degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Natural Sciences, or a related technical field.
  • Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, or similar).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Currently attending a degree program in Canada.
  • Availability to work full-time for a minimum of 12 weeks outside of university term. Ability to return to a degree program after completion of the internship.
  • Experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.
  • Experience contributing to research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in major conferences or journals.
  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages
  • Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

About the job

Join us for a full-time, 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development, an executive speaker series, and community-building. Research happens across Google everyday, in many different teams. Our research has already impacted user-facing services across Google, including Search, Maps, and Google Now, and is central to the success of Google Cloud and our planet-scale computing, storage, and networking infrastructure.

Research Interns aren\'t cloistered in the lab, but instead they work closely with Engineers to discover, invent, and build at the largest scale. Ideas may come from internal projects. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, Research Interns work on challenges in artificial intelligence, machine perception, data mining, machine learning, natural language understanding, privacy, computer architecture, networking, operating systems, storage and data management, and much more.

Google Research addresses challenges that define the technology of today and tomorrow. From conducting fundamental research to influencing product development, our research teams have the opportunity to impact technology used by billions of people every day.

Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field -- we publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and apply research to Google products.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute a research agenda.
  • Create and support a productive and innovative team, including working with peers, managers, and teams.

Locations

To navigate, press the arrow keys.

Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field -- we publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and apply research to Google products.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute a research agenda.
  • Create and support a productive and innovative team, including working with peers, managers, and teams.

item.title: Research Intern, BS, Fall 2022
item.description:
2022-04-18T14:02:05.568Z

Research Intern, BS, Fall 2022

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
  • + 1 more location
Apply

Please complete your application before August 26th, 2022. Participation in the internship program requires that you are located in Canada for the duration of the internship program.

NOTE: This internship is intended for students who are pursuing a BS degree with an anticipated graduation date before December 2023, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating after December 2023, we encourage you to apply to the Student Researcher opening.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume.


Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Waterloo, ON, Canada; Toronto, ON, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Natural Sciences, or a related technical field.
  • Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, or similar).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Currently attending a degree program in Canada.
  • Availability to work full-time for a minimum of 12 weeks outside of university term. Ability to return to a degree program after completion of the internship.
  • Experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.
  • Experience contributing to research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in major conferences or journals.
  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages.
  • Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

About the job

Join us for a full-time, 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development, an executive speaker series, and community-building. Research happens across Google everyday, in many different teams. Our research has already impacted user-facing services across Google, including Search, Maps, and Google Now, and is central to the success of Google Cloud and our planet-scale computing, storage, and networking infrastructure.

Research Interns aren\'t cloistered in the lab, but instead they work closely with Engineers to discover, invent, and build at the largest scale. Ideas may come from internal projects. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, Research Interns work on challenges in artificial intelligence, machine perception, data mining, machine learning, natural language understanding, privacy, computer architecture, networking, operating systems, storage and data management, and much more.

Google Research addresses challenges that define the technology of today and tomorrow. From conducting fundamental research to influencing product development, our research teams have the opportunity to impact technology used by billions of people every day.

Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field -- we publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and apply research to Google products.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute a research agenda.
  • Create and support a productive and innovative team, including working with peers, managers, and teams.

item.title: Mobility Category Go-To-Market Manager, Google Pixel
item.description:
2022-05-06T19:31:51.239Z

Mobility Category Go-To-Market Manager, Google Pixel

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree in Business, related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in telcommunications, consumer electronics, or equivalent industry.
  • 5 years of experience in Go-To-Market, category management, or equivalent field.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working in a sales operations, product demand/supply planning, production and/or inventory management capacity.
  • Experience with Tableau, Salesforce, Google Workplace, Google Analytics, SQL, or Plex tables.
  • Ability to balance long-term strategic thinking with near-term execution skills, and take complex data and synthesize it into meaningful and coherent stories.
  • Business, analytical, reporting, data manipulation, dashboard creation, template building, and business intelligence skills.
  • Excellent business judgment, problem-solving, project management, and analytical skills.

About the job

The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

In this role, you will be responsible for driving Google Pixel accessories, product channel strategy, and business planning for the AMER region specifically focusing on telcommunication partners throughout the product’s lifecycle. We work with a variety of stakeholders from Sales, Supply Chain, and Marketing to launch products with our third-party partners. Our team leads the organization through the partner and channel strategy and activates the Go-To-Market strategy. In this role, you will work with a variety of stakeholders across Google from Sales, Supply chain, Finance, Legal, and Marketing to launch hardware products and manage the after-launch analytics.

The Google Pixel team focuses on designing and delivering the world\'s most helpful mobile experience. The team works on shaping the future of Pixel devices and services through some of the most advanced designs, techniques, products, and experiences in consumer electronics. This includes bringing together the best of Google’s artificial intelligence, software, and hardware to build global smartphones and create transformative experiences for users across the world.

Responsibilities

  • Assess top down market sizing and opportunities, competitive positioning, consumer trends, and product strenghts/weaknesses to inform strategic priorities and opportunities.
  • Be able to jointly shape Mobility Category strategic plans, including annual business planning, analyses on strategic opportunities, and rapid growth plans. 
  • Create cross-funtional Go-To-Market plans, including goal setting, cross-functional business planning, trade-offs, prioritization of opportunities, and scenario analysis. Work with executive management and business stakeholders to align on launch plans.
  • Develop promo, business strategy, manage the budget for Mobility category (e.g., products and accessories), and partner with Finance on profitability and budget management. 
  • Lead the business cadence of annual/quarterly/weekly planning and course corrections, and lead business readouts to executive leadership, extracting trends and insights, and identifying opportunities to grow the business.

Location

item.title: Revenue Lead, News and Publishing, Global Partnerships
item.description:
2022-05-02T20:31:51.127Z

Revenue Lead, News and Publishing, Global Partnerships

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience within programmatic advertising, partner management, digital marketing, client facing strategy and business development, and ad serving.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with technology platforms and working with technical stakeholders (e.g., internal and external)
  • Experience working with programmatic advertising technology platforms (e.g.,Google Ad Manager or other Sell Side Platforms) with knowledge of evolving programmatic ads ecosystem
  • Experience with team-based client management and selling approach with the ability to grow in a rapidly changing industry
  • Experience in using data to identify trends or opportunities and then visualizing that data when making recommendations with a detail-oriented and analytical focus
  • Ability to prioritize, plan, and organize business activity with excellent partner relations, account management, and sales skills

About the job

The Global Partnerships team works with Canada’s media companies to help them transform and grow their digital products and business. With a specific focus on the Google Ad Manager platform, we advise on our partners\' programmatic media business and support their broader partnership across relevant Google products.

In this role, you will be responsible for leading business generation for our News and Publishing clients. You will support our partners. You will draft compelling narratives that educate our partners about Google\'s latest advertising products and technologies. You will provide excellent client service, research, and market analysis. You will anticipate how selections are made and persistently explore and uncover the business needs of our clients.

Google’s Global Partnerships team powers extraordinary user experiences through partnerships that solve users’ needs, advance our partners’ goals, and further Google’s mission. Our team provides meaningful solutions — from helping publishers and developers grow their businesses through monetization solutions, to helping our long-term partners anticipate and navigate change in a way that delivers economic and reputational value. We build and distribute products through partnerships across a multitude of product areas, including Ads, Search & Assistant, Geo, Platforms & Ecosystems, Devices & Services, Health, Retail, Payments, Next Billion Users, and more. We collaborate across Google, ensuring a coordinated approach when engaging with our most complex and strategic partners.

Responsibilities

  • Develop relationships with partners, Ad Operations, and Yield Management teams by becoming a trusted business generation advisor.
  • Understand the full scope of a publisher partner business including inventory trends, direct and indirect channel priorities, and participants. Understand how business generation fits into broader business strategy.
  • Optimize usage of Google’s business generation suite in consultation with partners based on performance analysis. Develop frameworks to evaluate the success of implemented optimizations, taking and sharing best practices from News and Publishing partners globally.
  • Work cross-functionally with technical support teams, analytics teams, and account teams within the Vertical. Engage with them to deliver insights, ideas, and customer service that drives business growth for our clients and for Google.
  • Build scaled ways to solve common partner business needs and share best practices (e.g., analysis, tools, frameworks) and client successes.

Location

item.title: Partner Operations Manager, Music, YouTube
item.description:
2022-04-29T16:31:57.431Z

Partner Operations Manager, Music, YouTube

  • YouTube
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience in customer support or client services experience troubleshooting and resolving customer issues.
  • Experience working in the Music industry, with Music stakeholders, or in Music Rights Management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Knowledge of data analytics, data visualization, spreadsheets, and/or SQL.
  • Knowledge of the Canadian Music industry and current Canadian policies.
  • Ability to troubleshoot complex, technical issues.
  • Ability to be proactive, making constructive suggestions, and coming up with innovative ways to scale initiatives.
  • Ability to manage competing priorities and multiple clients.

About the job

As a member of the Partner Operations team, you\'ll analyze top issues facing our content creators, work with cross-functional teams to resolve them, and help manage support operations. Whether directly engaging with our biggest creators, surfacing problems to our technical teams, driving analytical insights, or liaising with vendors to provide stellar support, you\'ll drive reach, satisfaction, and resolution — making YouTube an exceptional user experience for everyone.

In this role, you will provide YouTube support to some of our managed Label partners. You will become a YouTube product expert, solve the day-to-day issues of our Music partners, and identify common trends that our partners face. You will also be responsible for advocating on behalf of our partners to cross-functional teams in order to drive product solutions, and for developing process improvements that enhance internal operations. You will work closely with other partner-facing teams to provide value-add services to help increase our Music partner\'s growth.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

Responsibilities

  • Provide operational support to managed partners on the YouTube platform, primarily through email communication.
  • Serve as a consultant to internal, cross-functional stakeholders on the YouTube product. Work with assigned Strategic Partner Managers and Partner Technology Managers to develop business plans and share insights for partner growth.
  • Drive, measure, and analyze overall partner performance as well as streamline operational workflows and process improvements.
  • Contribute to scaling Partner Operations for YouTube through innovation, efficiency gains, and root cause analysis.
  • Evaluate data both quantitatively and qualitatively, and use data to visually tell a compelling story.

Location

To navigate, press the arrow keys.

item.title: Analytical Lead, Large Customer Sales
item.description:
2022-04-13T04:02:11.522Z

Analytical Lead, Large Customer Sales

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience with client-facing analytics or strategy consulting.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working cross-functionally and building relationships with external clients and internal teams.
  • Experience using SQL, R, or similar tools.
  • Experience with digital marketing and web analytics platforms.
  • Demonstrated ability to use storytelling to lead effective client and internal meetings.
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize using a principled approach.

About the job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google\'s key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

As an Analytical Lead, you will be a strategic analyst, advisor and consultant, providing data supported insights to clients across the finance and travel industry along with agencies to help improve their business. You will also be an influencer to teammates and clients in how they think about measuring the value that they get from their marketing efforts.

In this role, you\'ll work with some of Google\'s most advanced performance advertisers to prove and maximize Google\'s impact on their business objectives. You will work with advertising agencies and clients as a team member on Google\'s industry-focused Sales team, exchanging knowledge regarding client and agency needs within specific industry sectors.

You will work with a cross-functional team to present integrated, data-driven business opportunities based on internal and external tools analysis. You\'ll own measurement for your vertical and work with advertising agencies and clients to create impact on their business.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Plan and execute client-specific measurement roadmaps to improve client’s measurement maturity.
  • Advise on and execute analytical methods (e.g., attribution, experimentation, and media mix modeling) to prove the impact of Google media on client business objectives.
  • Build and own client relationships with media and analytics decision-makers to influence investment and measurement decisions.
  • Leverage Google, market, and client data to uncover growth opportunities for clients\' businesses and inform their digital marketing investment strategy with Google.

item.title: Analytical Lead, Large Customer Sales
item.description:
2022-04-13T04:02:11.522Z

Analytical Lead, Large Customer Sales

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience with client-facing analytics or strategy consulting.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working cross-functionally and building relationships with external clients and internal teams.
  • Experience using SQL, R, or similar tools.
  • Experience with digital marketing and web analytics platforms.
  • Demonstrated ability to use storytelling to lead effective client and internal meetings.
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize using a principled approach.

About the job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google\'s key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

As an Analytical Lead, you will be a strategic analyst, advisor and consultant, providing data supported insights to clients across the finance and travel industry along with agencies to help improve their business. You will also be an influencer to teammates and clients in how they think about measuring the value that they get from their marketing efforts.

In this role, you\'ll work with some of Google\'s most advanced performance advertisers to prove and maximize Google\'s impact on their business objectives. You will work with advertising agencies and clients as a team member on Google\'s industry-focused Sales team, exchanging knowledge regarding client and agency needs within specific industry sectors.

You will work with a cross-functional team to present integrated, data-driven business opportunities based on internal and external tools analysis. You\'ll own measurement for your vertical and work with advertising agencies and clients to create impact on their business.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Plan and execute client-specific measurement roadmaps to improve client’s measurement maturity.
  • Advise on and execute analytical methods (e.g., attribution, experimentation, and media mix modeling) to prove the impact of Google media on client business objectives.
  • Build and own client relationships with media and analytics decision-makers to influence investment and measurement decisions.
  • Leverage Google, market, and client data to uncover growth opportunities for clients\' businesses and inform their digital marketing investment strategy with Google.
  • Advise clients on best practices for marketing analytics within broader context of industry standards, and provide ongoing customer consultation on how to implement best practices.

Location

item.title: Enterprise Sales Developer, Security and Compliance, Google Cloud
item.description:
2021-10-04T13:25:23.445Z

Enterprise Sales Developer, Security and Compliance, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role.
  • Experience addressing CIO and CISO concerns about security and compliance risks.
  • Experience in performing technical presentations or public speaking.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Advanced degree (i.e. MBA, Master\'s).
  • Experience with tools, technology and best practices in network security, data protection and identity and access management.
  • Technical business experience or professional consulting experience.
  • Knowledge of ISO 27001, SOC 2/3 audit, FedRamp, PCI, and HIPAA.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Sales Developer focused on Security and Compliance, you\'ll address technical security and compliance challenges during engagements with customers and partner with internal stakeholders to improve products and build solutions.

In this role, you will be the security and compliance subject matter expert to differentiate Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners recognize the power of Google Cloud, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, and conduct problem-solving for any potential roadblocks.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Work with customers to resolve existing and potential technical security and compliance obstacles, to adoption and consumption of Google Cloud services.
  • Enhance knowledge and drive technical security and compliance enablement internally at Google Cloud, and create best practices for our customers.
  • Work cross-functionally as a customer advocate to provide insights and contribute to programs in areas of security, privacy, and regulatory compliance with internal teams, e.g, Marketing, Product Development, Legal, and Policy teams.
  • Serve as a public advocate of Google Cloud and Cloud Computing at conferences, industry training, and related events.

Location

item.title: Director, Canada Strategic Industries, Sales, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-06-06T16:32:04.879Z

Director, Canada Strategic Industries, Sales, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Applications will be accepted through June 20, 2022.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience
  • 15 years of sales leadership experience in the sales/business development function, including experience leading teams
  • 10 years of experience in Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) and/or Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) sales role, and experience growing and leading an organization
  • 10 years of experience selling IT solutions to companies

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree
  • Experience in customer engagement, including growing the business/product with C-level decision makers
  • Experience in cloud computing
  • Understanding of enterprise software/infrastructure marketplace, key players, and technical factors driving landscape
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and ability to be a change management leader that envisions new approaches to the business, advocates them to the right stakeholders, and leads the change process, including experience with marketing or sales support in developing product, solution messaging, narratives, and value propositions
  • Outstanding problem solving, technical, cross-functional leadership, collaboration, and project management skills, with excellent attention to detail and communication/presentation skills

About the job

Google is developing groundbreaking cloud solutions for businesses, leveraging experience in building secure, reliable, and scalable cloud technology. Google’s Cloud team is responsible for everything from the underlying cloud infrastructure to the business user-facing apps. The Google Cloud business and its portfolio of products helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers, and software infrastructure.

As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes using technology to connect with customers, employees, and partners. Central Strategic Industries is one of the key markets for Google in North America, with an ambitious growth agenda across Canada with a focus on Telecommunications, Financial Services, and Retail.

In this role, you will be the representative of Google Cloud and will drive how Central Strategic industries, partners, and consumers view Google Cloud. You will have responsibility for the strategy and execution of the organization’s business plan, as well as the goal for achieving milestones within the market. Your role will be to drive business growth and customer acquisition for Google Cloud. In addition, you will be the point of contact for Google Cloud Canada Strategic Industries internally and will work cross-functionally to ensure alignment and an integrated go-to-market with other organizations, including Marketing and Operations.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute the Canada Strategic Industries Google Cloud strategy. Deliver growth for Google Cloud Canada Strategic Industries, including attracting and developing a team. Manage Canada Strategic Industries Sales Leadership team.
  • Lead people through change and leverage team resources cross-functionally.
  • Contribute to the growth and direction of Google Cloud products and services. Ensure product launches are successfully communicated to the local market. Build plans for business growth, go-to-market, adoption, and thought leadership, and build scalable processes and promote Google Cloud products.
  • Develop appropriate business playbooks, tools, and guides to increase engagement in accounts and develop excellent strategies.
  • Understand customer requirements to develop/provide custom presentations on products to solve their business problems. Tailor solutions and product collateral to the needs of the market.

Location

To navigate, press the arrow keys.

item.title: Cloud Customer Experience Lead, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-06-01T20:31:48.449Z

Cloud Customer Experience Lead, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of customer-facing experience, working with executives, and driving customer development programs.
  • Experience managing customer organizational structures, developing technology programs, defining milestones, success criteria, resource allocation, and on-time delivery.
  • Experience driving digital development using cloud-based solutions (IaaS/PaaS) and managing initiatives across engineering, sales, support, and services.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree in a management, technical, or engineering field.
  • 20 years of experience working in a customer-facing role.
  • Experience leading large enterprise organizations through a people, process, and technology transformation of building and operating legacy, on-premise software to running full speed as a digital native in the public cloud.
  • Experience with data center migration strategies, collaborating with channel partners/systems integrators.
  • Knowledge of Google Cloud ecosystem.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, problem-solving, conflict resolution, and program management skills.

About the job

In this role, you will act as a trusted advisor to Google Cloud’s customers by enabling them to use Google’s Cloud products to achieve their business objectives. You will partner with customers to develop and execute success plans (e.g., organizational, programmatic, and technical strategies) to meet their business objectives and stakeholder goals. You will work with customers to remove organizational and technical barriers and identify opportunities to help customers expand their use of Google Cloud products. You will recommend best practices and organizational changes to accelerate their onboarding and migration plans. You will also act as a customer advocate for product features and requirements.

You will lead the successful adoption of Google Cloud, guiding customers through the people, process, and technology facets of their cloud transformation journey. You will work across customer-facing teams to ensure that a customer’s experience on Google Cloud exceeds their expectations.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Drive the successful adoption and on-boarding of Google Cloud at key organizations to help customers realize the business value of our partnership and offerings.
  • Create value for customers by partnering to define success and build a joint plan with identified objectives, stakeholders, milestones, risks, and metrics needed to achieve their goals.
  • Develop strategic relationships with key stakeholders to understand a customer’s business within their industry and develop strategic road-maps.
  • Guide IT executives through the organizational changes needed to unlock the full value of the cloud, and help them staff, train, and align their team members and partners to deliver on their cloud transformation.
  • Partner with customer-facing account teams and executives to develop strategic and technical plans that help customers achieve their business objectives.

Location

item.title: Customer Solutions Developer, Google Technical Professional Services
item.description:
2022-05-13T14:31:44.944Z

Customer Solutions Developer, Google Technical Professional Services

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
  • 2 years of experience working with web technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and/or HTTP)
  • Experience coding with a programming language (e.g., Java, C/C++, Python)

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working with and managing internal and external partners/customers
  • Experience with the ad serving industry and internet technologies, data integration projects, and cloud technologies
  • Ability to adapt a message to the technical level of an audience and present technical materials to groups of any size
  • Excellent problem solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent attention to detail and project management skills

About the job

gTech’s Professional Services team takes a creative, collaborative, and customer-centric approach to provide foundational services and forward-looking business solutions to top advertiser and publisher customers. Through technical implementation, optimization, and key solutions, gTech Professional Services helps customers attain their business goals while building long-term capabilities.

In this role, you will develop innovative solutions to the business problems faced by advertisers. You will work as a critical technical partner for our Sales teams. You will develop solutions that will take many forms, from prototypes and demos to education all with the technology resources of Google to back it up. Seeing the unique business challenges faced by our advertisers, you will be identifying and prioritizing projects and will be developing solutions. Working across the entire organization, you will leverage your wide-ranging experience and skill-set to find the best solution for the problems.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with customers to understand underlying business challenges.
  • Build relationships with the Sales team and customers, then leverage these relationships to identify and develop innovative technical solutions that lead to more advertising business.
  • Design, create, and present prototypes, demos, and proofs-of-concept to a wide variety of audiences, from Developers to Marketing. Leverage Google’s Cloud infrastructure and big data analytics systems to achieve goals.
  • Provide technical consulting services and guidance around Google APIs and Google Cloud platforms to help clients develop applications across products.

Location

item.title: Customer Solutions Developer, Google Technical Professional Services
item.description:
2022-05-13T14:31:44.944Z

Customer Solutions Developer, Google Technical Professional Services

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
  • 2 years of experience working with web technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and/or HTTP)
  • Experience coding with a programming language (e.g., Java, C/C++, Python)

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working with and managing internal and external partners/customers
  • Experience with the ad serving industry and internet technologies, data integration projects, and cloud technologies
  • Ability to adapt a message to the technical level of an audience and present technical materials to groups of any size
  • Excellent problem solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent attention to detail and project management skills

About the job

gTech’s Professional Services team takes a creative, collaborative, and customer-centric approach to provide foundational services and forward-looking business solutions to top advertiser and publisher customers. Through technical implementation, optimization, and key solutions, gTech Professional Services helps customers attain their business goals while building long-term capabilities.

In this role, you will develop innovative solutions to the business problems faced by advertisers. You will work as a critical technical partner for our Sales teams. You will develop solutions that will take many forms, from prototypes and demos to education all with the technology resources of Google to back it up. Seeing the unique business challenges faced by our advertisers, you will be identifying and prioritizing projects and will be developing solutions. Working across the entire organization, you will leverage your wide-ranging experience and skill-set to find the best solution for the problems.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with customers to understand underlying business challenges.
  • Build relationships with the Sales team and customers, then leverage these relationships to identify and develop innovative technical solutions that lead to more advertising business.
  • Design, create, and present prototypes, demos, and proofs-of-concept to a wide variety of audiences, from Developers to Marketing. Leverage Google’s Cloud infrastructure and big data analytics systems to achieve goals.
  • Provide technical consulting services and guidance around Google APIs and Google Cloud platforms to help clients develop applications across products.

Location
