The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit https://ottomotors.com

About the Job

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms, all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, machine learning, computer vision and more.

Systems Engineering is about creating something that is more than the sum of the parts.  You will be responsible for using your varied experience and appropriate modelling and analytical methodologies to determine the solution to a product problem by applying the optimum combination of mechanical, electronic and software solutions. You will work directly with the other teams in the Software, Electronics, Test and Mechanical Design disciplines to interpret the product requirements and produce an integrated product. You will then be responsible for defining the specifications of the final product and validating that it meets the requirements.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Creating & maintaining a variety of engineering diagrams (Architecture, Context, State, Process/Swimlane) to communicate design intent
  • Collect, document and track status of System Requirements
  • Create test plans for requirement verification
  • Perform System validation testing

Additional tasks may include:

  • Decomposition of product needs into system requirements
  • Identify gaps in the design vs the product expectations.
  • Analysis of product, it’s structure and interactions of subsystems

Required Skills:

  • Understanding of the Product Development Lifecycle
  • Exposure /Experience/Ability to work in a broad range of interdisciplinary departments: mechanical, electrical, software design and manufacturing
  • Strong Excel/Word/Powerpoint (or Google equivalents) skills
  • Excellent teamwork/communication skills
  • Experience with Visio/Lucidcharts or similar for creating Process and Block diagrams
  • Ability to independently develop high quality software solutions
  • Creative problem-solving skills, excellent analytical abilities and ability to work in a team
  • Demonstration of Systems thinking

Bonus points for:

  • Experience with 3D CAD software (pref. Solidworks)
  • Software development skills in modern C++/C# and python
  • Experience with ROS
  • Proficiency with Linux

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Web Applications Developer Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position:              Web Applications Developer Co-op
Location:             Kitchener, Ontario              
Student Level:    Junior / Intermediate
Education:          Computer Science/Computer Engineering/Software Engineering 

About OTTO™ Motors
OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit https://ottomotors.com

About the job:
The OTTO Motors branch of Clearpath is looking for a software developer/engineering co-op to join the Fleet Application team.

In Fleet Applications, we are responsible for the design, development, and support of software applications that allow our users to interact with, monitor and support their fleets of OTTO Autonomous Vehicles. This involves participation in the entire product workflow, from customer insight gathering, problem definition, solution proposals, application design, development, and support.

For this role, we are seeking an individual to help us extend and harden our React based component library that is used to build our fleet management and robot web interfaces You would be working closely with our UX specialists, Fleet test team and application developers to implement polished and robust user experiences that make interacting with autonomous vehicles as effortless as possible.

Your primary responsibilities will include:

  • Implementing new and updating existing React components within our component library to meet product and usability requirements
  • Ensuring components are responsive, robust, and performant.
  • Using Storybook to create use case examples and documentation for our component library
  • Creating new automated tests for components
  • Leveraging new and existing components to add and replace existing capabilities within our application suite
  • Working closely with UX and other applications developers to brainstorm new patterns and methodologies for solving usability needs

About You:
You see the potential in intelligent robotics to change the world, and you want a career where you’ll get to make this happen personally. You want to work for a technology company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You like being the go-to person for technical questions. You are motivated by creating solutions for users that they find delight in using, and find pride and joy in building interfaces that are polished, flexible and easy to use.

Skills and experience:

  • Experience using ReactJS for creating web applications
  • Proficient writing efficient and robust HTML5 / ES6 / CSS
  • Building user interfaces to align with provided designs and patterns
  • Experience implementing responsive styling for a variety of form factors
  • Understanding of using web application build tools (for example, webpack, babel, npm)
  • Familiar with source control, work management systems (for example, Jira), and creating functional documentation

Bonus Points For:

  • Comfortable using Ubuntu and shell terminals
  • Familiar with existing component libraries and how they are used
  • Experience with git and continuous integration tools such as Jenkins
  • Writing mobile based applications with touch interfaces
  • Experience with ROS / Robotics Systems

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Autonomy Engineer - Multi-agent Navigation
item.description:
Description

Position:            Autonomy Engineer- Multi-agent-Navigation         
Location:           Kitchener, Ontario or Remote/Virtual, Canada           
Experience:      1-5 years of relevant work experience
Education:        Graduate Degree in a related field
Division:            OTTO Motors

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit https://ottomotors.com/

About the Job

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms for navigation, collaboration, and control - all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the core software for fleets of multi-ton robots, find optimal routes through the most complex work environments around the world, and safely balance millimeter tracking accuracy with maximum driving performance.

The navigation team’s primary responsibility is robotics software development, testing, and support. You will be responsible for identifying opportunities to improve our self-driving capabilities, selecting the best research and/or industry algorithms to employ, and developing high-performance implementations that expand our core autonomy software. As part of the team, your input will be integral for reviewing and supporting the designs, implementations, and tests developed by other autonomy engineers. Finally, as part of OTTO, we work closely with both industry and academia, where you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with our partners and see your ideas making a measurable difference in the world.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Developing collaboration, navigation, and control software
  • Testing/reviewing software for reliability/performance
  • Conducting research projects to expand our capabilities
  • Supporting deployment, product, and testing teams

Additional tasks may include:

  • Collaborating with academic/industry partners
  • Mentoring and assisting with supervision of interns
  • Writing research papers for academic publication
  • Explaining our newest shiny toys to sales & marketing

About You

You want to work for a company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, here to make a difference, and never satisfied with work left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and thrive on challenging, rewarding problems.

Required Technical Skills:

  • Graduate degree in engineering or a related field, with applicable background
  • Practical knowledge in two or more areas of: path planning, motion planning, mobile robot control, vehicle modelling, and multi-agent systems
  • Strong software development skills in Modern C++
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • Hands-on experience with autonomous systems

Desired Soft Skills:

  • Ability to efficiently and clearly communicate ideas, including to those who may have a limited theoretical background in the area
  • Ability to reliably plan and estimate development time requirements
  • A learning mindset and positive attitude
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines, job responsibilities, and the local gravity field

Bonus points for:

  • ROS experience
  • Strong Python / Lua skills
  • Experience with the control of differential drive, bicycle, and tricycle ground vehicles
  • Understanding of sensors and their error models, particularly laser rangefinders, GPS systems, and vision systems


At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Manufacturing Engineering Manager
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position: Manufacturing Engineering Manager
Location: Kitchener, Ontario 
Experience: 5+ years of relevant experience
Education: Bachelor’s degree in mechanical/manufacturing engineering, or similar
Division: OTTO Motors

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

As a leading technology company, our existing products are constantly evolving and new ones are emerging. In this position, your goal is to provide strategic oversight to our Manufacturing Engineering team as they launch new products while also supporting improvements to our existing assembly lines.

As our Manufacturing Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for seizing opportunities to improve safety, quality, and cycle time across our assembly lines.  You are super-organized and have strong attention to detail.  You hold safety as the highest priority and are able to identify and implement controls for factors that may impact product quality.  You will use your experience with production processes to bring large-scale improvements that will help our builders do their best work.

 Primary responsibilities include:

  • Mentoring and providing support to a team of Manufacturing Engineering Specialists and Technologists
  • Monitoring your team’s workload and delegating tasks as needed to meet deadlines under shifting priorities
  • Reviewing and approving the team’s solutions and their requisitions for new equipment
  • Creating & revising high-level process documentation as needed to reflect current practices
  • Participating in the change management process from the design review stage through to implementation in the production environment
  • Assisting with the investigation & resolution of health & safety issues
  • Preparing cost-benefit analyses as needed to support authorizations for expenditure
  • Problem-solving and taking corrective action as per the DMAIC framework
  • Planning and managing projects to support continuous improvement initiatives and new product launches
  • Interfacing with external vendors as needed to bring solutions in house
  • Record-keeping and scheduling recurring audits and activities to support internal Quality and Health & Safety processes
  • Coordinating inspections and calibration for tooling and equipment
  • Overseeing our return material authorization process (RMA) and dispatching technologists to perform repairs
  • Assisting in the development of in-process quality control procedures and tests
  • Maintenance & monitoring of the ERP system (Epicor)

About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with less than 100% effort.  You pride yourself on a job well done.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Required Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in mechanical/manufacturing engineering, or similar
  • 5+ years’ engineering experience, 2+ years management experience
  • Excellent analytical and communication skills
  • A keen eye for detail and a results driven approach
  • Competent in problem solving, team building, planning and decision making
  • Able to interpret mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • Understanding of electromechanical assembly processes
  • Familiar with engineering change management
  • Lean manufacturing experience

 Nice to have:

  • Past experience in a design role (mechanical or electrical)
  • P.Eng License
  • Project management experience
  • Lean Six Sigma training
  • Familiar with the OHSA & its associated regulations

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Mechanical Designer
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position:           Mechanical Designer     

Location:          Kitchener, Ontario              

Experience:      Minimum 2-5 years

Education:        College diploma or university degree in a related field.

Division:           OTTO Motors 

 

About Us

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

 

About the Job

We are shipping more and more robots and seeing new uses for our products emerge every day!  We need an experienced Mechanical Engineer to help us take our innovative designs from napkin sketches to hundreds of pounds of precisely moving parts, and facilitate every step in-between.

You are a mechanical engineering guru with years of experience who is able to inspire and teach others. In your role you will be responsible for the mechanical / mechatronics designs of existing and new industrial robotics products. This will range through the entire design process from initial concept design and cost forecasting through to detailed design, verification and validation, and final release to production.  Our hardware must be many things, but reliability is paramount.  It will be your job to design and build robust robotic systems that adhere to the high standards of performance and quality that we set for our products.

 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Leading engineering activities and collaborating with multiple cross-functional teams to bring tasks to fruition.
  • Developing our line of innovative industrial robots for worldwide customers.
  • Preparation of large BOMs and supporting their review and approval.
  • Assist with Drawing file system administration, project documentation and organizing requirements.
  • Performing ground-up design work supported by engineering fundamentals, calculations and testing.
  • Encouraging others through your example to achieve their potential as an engineer.
  • Working closely with the test and production teams to develop sustainable designs.
  • Facilitating a smooth operation through proper documentation (JIRA, Trello, Confluence, Notion, etc.).

 

Additional tasks may include:

  • Evaluating how we can apply lessons from other industries to our designs.
  • Collaborating with our client success team to support our customers.
  • Supporting the evaluation of existing and new suppliers.

 

About You

You want to work for a fast-paced growing company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done or half-qualified.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

 

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Degree in Mechanical or Mechatronics Engineering from an accredited institution, or equivalent.
  • Minimum 5+ years of relevant experience designing electro-mechanical machine designs for industrial applications with high reliability and high volume.
  • Excellent skills with SolidWorks or similar parametric CAD and finite element analysis software.
  • Solid design intuition with a deep understanding of manufacturing processes and methods.
  • Strong mechanical design and analysis skills in the areas of kinematics, structural/stress, thermal, and vibration analysis. 
  • The ability to help define unknown systems from the ground-up.
  • Ability to collaborate with external suppliers and fabrication shops to ensure successful outcomes.
  • Hands-on prototyping experience including prototyping methods.
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills.
  • Ability to work closely as part of a multi-disciplinary team in a fast-paced environment.

 

Bonus points for:

  • Designed parts for high production volumes and experience with high throughput manufacturing and assembly methods.
  • Experience on design teams and/or teams such as Robotics, FSAE, Hyperloop (hands-on with design experience).
  • Experience with vehicle design (e.g. utility tractors, fork trucks, AGVs, effectively anything with a drive train that has to handle the dynamics of being mobile) or automation.
  • Experience in industrial certifications and compliance with UL / CE or similar standards.
  • Strong skills in electrical/electronic design.
  • Experience designing for an industrial environment.

 

 

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Mechatronics Designer
item.description:
Description

About Company
Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through the development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About OTTO Motors
OTTO Motors is the industrial division of Clearpath Robotics. OTTO Motors provides self-driving technology for material handling inside manufacturing facilities and warehouses. OTTO is trusted for mission-critical deliveries spanning the most demanding of industrial environments. Recognized brands such as GE, Toyota, and Nestle trust their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors.

About the Job

You will be responsible for working with members of OTTO Motors’ electrical product team as we develop new vehicles for our expanding fleet. You will work with our Electrical Engineering team to develop electrical systems, help build the robots from the ground up,  repair robots, as well as maintain test equipment, and instrumentation. You will also help us continue to increase the difficulty of our testing and assist with engineering-led testing and service at client facilities. Finally, you will work with key members of the wider company to transition our work to the broader organization, including Testing, Quality, Production, Client Success, Professional Services, and other groups.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • On-the-fly wiring, assembly, and modification of a small quantity of large vehicles
  • Assist Electrical Engineers during verification and test procedures
  • Development of testing and documentation for vehicles and subsystems. 
  • Repair or replace various subsystems of the robot as needed.
  • Keeping engineering’s test/build facilities organized and maintained.

Additional tasks:

  • Any other design or development work that needs to be done which you are capable of.
  • Assisting the project team with initial test deployments
  • Support of initial systems alongside the rest of the project team

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

Required skills:

  • Possess skills in reading and interpreting technical drawings, electrical schematics prints, electrical and harness drawings. 
  • Experience in building and installing electrical harnesses and cables, connector and component selection, systems wiring. 
  • Has already encountered robots breaking in unpredictable ways at the worst possible times
  • Experience with getting technical multi-discipline tasks done quickly
  • Comfortable working in small groups with minimal oversight
  • Working knowledge in relation to safety when working with electrical and electronic equipment. 

Bonus points for one or more of the following:

  • Experience with Vesys and/or Altium
  • Electrical panel build experience is considered an asset.
  • Good attention to detail, organization, and time management skills.
  • Familiar with CSA/UL Standards
  • Past experience learning from development projects that have gone wrong
  • Basic ROS experience

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Software Deployment Engineer (Fleet Manager)
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position: Software Deployment Engineer (Fleet Manager)

Location: Kitchener, Ontario             

Experience: 3+ Years of relevant related experience

Education: Post-Secondary degree or diploma in Computer Systems Technology or related field

Division: OTTO Motors


About OTTO™ Motors

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through the development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About the Opportunity

We are looking for a Software Deployment Engineer who will be responsible for the design, integration, and evolution of Clearpath\'s Fleet Manager deployment and configuration process. You will research and evaluate new technologies for the software deployment strategy, as well as working to evolve best practices. You will be working closely with other members of the development team as well as many other groups within OTTO Motors, championing both vision and strategy for the deployment of the Fleet Manager

Who You Are:

As a Software Deployment Engineer you know the ins and outs of infrastructure technologies applied to software deployment and strive to automate whatever you can along the way. You want ownership of the software and processes you create and maintain. You keep on top of the latest technologies and have an unnatural love for destroying things just to see how they work. You’re also an excellent communicator and team player, and you’ve got a real knack for coming up with solutions that make and keep people happy.

You come ready with:

  • 3+ years of experience within IT or Software development related role(s)
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • Strong Bash or other shell scripting language experience
  • Moderate to strong Debian based Linux skills - package management and configuration
  • Container deployment experience (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
  • Knowledge of configuration management technologies (Ansible, Chef, Puppet, etc.)
  • SCM experience (git, Gitlab, Github, Bitbucket, SVN, etc.)
  • Experience with software testing, and Continuous Integration process and CI systems (Jenkins, Gitlab CI, etc.)
  • Able to work in Canada

Bonus points for:

  • Python development experience
  • Experience with ticket and content management systems (JIRA, Confluence, etc.) 
  • Experience with web frameworks and SQL Databases (Django, Flask, etc.)
  • Experience working in a collaborative environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagrams, discussion, and examples
  • Ability to independently develop software development plans, including timelines and test procedures

What’s In It For You?

  • Work-life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Flexibility in when you work, core hours are 10am-3pm EST
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Additional perks to get you set up at home/work
  • Opportunity to make a difference with the world’s deadliest, dirtiest and dangerous jobs
  • Amazing co-workers to laugh and have fun
  • Engineering run quarterly Hack Days to pursue interests, passion projects, and experiments
  • Enjoy designing the future of robotics!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Software Performance Engineer
item.description:
Description

Position:Software Performance Engineer
Location: Hybrid work, based in Kitchener-Waterloo
Experience: 5+ years
Education: Undergraduate degree in engineering/CS or a related field
Division: OTTO Motors

About Our Opportunity

At OTTO Motors (division of Clearpath Robotics, Inc), we design flexible and intelligent autonomous mobile robots for industry, with the ultimate goal of automating the world\'s dullest, dirtiest, and deadliest jobs. 

You will be joining the OS (Operating Systems) team, who are responsible for bridging the gap between the mechanical machine, the autonomy stack and the fleet manager. In this team, you will have the opportunity to experience a very broad software stack ranging from kernel device drivers, application layer components, networking components and fleet management functionality. Your code and contributions will ultimately run on the robots, supporting leading edge technology in large fleets of automation in factories, already deployed and growing.

As a Software Performance Engineer, you will: 

  • Investigate and drive improvements in incidental and long term system stability and performance (Linux, C/C++, Python, ROS, ROS2, CUDA, Gazebo)
  • Help design and build sustainable pipelines for automated performance metrics against build, runtime and communications
  • Explore and define roadmaps of CPU and GPU architectures for OTTO robots
  • Drive the adoption of tools, techniques and processes to improve software at the desk of every developer
  • Participate in cross-team coding and architecture reviews with a keen eye on performance challenges
  • Triage and support live industrial systems in our test facilities

You come ready with:

  • 5+ years of experience working on C++ projects
  • Software system performance, post mortem and forensic analysis experience
  • Linux system diagnostics, LTTng, VTune, Valgrind or similar toolchain experience.
  • nVidia CUDA / ARM experience 
  • Static and dynamic code analysis experience
  • Moderate to strong Linux platform experience (more than CLI, bordering on kernel compilation)
  • Undergraduate degree in engineering/CS or a related field, with applicable background
  • Working knowledge of the Git version control system
  • Excellent teamwork and communication skills
  • Able to work in Canada

What’s in it for you:

  • Work-life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Flexibility in when you work, core hours are 10am-3pm EST
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Additional perks to get you set up at home/work
  • Opportunity to make a difference with the world’s deadliest, dirtiest and dangerous jobs
  • Amazing co-workers to laugh and have fun 
  • Engineering run Hack Days to pursue interests, passion projects, and experiments
  • The future of robotics!

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

At OTTO Motors, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: People and Culture Business Partner
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position:     People and Culture Business Partner
Location:    Kitchener, Ontario
Experience: 5+ years of progressive experience
Education:  Degree or diploma in Human Resources or relevant program
Division:     OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

As the People and Culture Business Partner, you will be immersed in the business strategy and objectives of your client groups.  You will have intimate knowledge of the client\'s business challenges and you will make recommendations from the people\'s perspective.  You will tailor people programs and initiatives to suit the unique needs of your client groups.  You will be a trusted advisor, helping your clients manage the day-to-day.  You will work alongside our management team to coach and develop current and future leaders. You’ll also act as an employee champion and change agent, working to proactively communicate employee needs and develop applicable solutions.

You’ll own the development and implementation of various people projects and programs, including aspects of our internal leadership development program and employee engagement initiatives. You’ll enjoy a broad and diverse scope of responsibilities as you work with a small but dedicated People Team to build an amazing experience for current and future Clearpathians.  

No two days will ever be the same! Your core responsibilities will include:

  • Deeply understanding the business of your client groups and recommending and implementing People strategies that support the business strategy
  • Acting as a trusted advisor to various levels of management, coaching and supporting them through people-related challenges, and helping to develop inspiring leaders
  • Recruits, interviews, and facilitates the hiring of qualified job applicants for open positions; collaborates with departmental managers to understand skills and competencies required for openings.
  • Performs routine tasks required to administer and execute human resource programs including but not limited to compensation, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; occupational health and safety; and training and development.
  • Handles employment-related inquiries from applicants, employees, and supervisors, referring complex and/or sensitive matters to the appropriate staff.
  • Maintains compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; reviews policies and practices to maintain compliance.
  • Maintains knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law.
  • Provides day-to-day performance management guidance to line management (e.g., coaching, counseling, career development, disciplinary actions).
  • Works closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention.
  • Provides HR policy guidance and interpretation.
  • Supports recruitment and set up of international employees and related HR matters.
  • Provides guidance and input on business unit restructures, workforce planning, and succession planning.
  • Identifies training needs for business units and individual executive coaching needs.
  • Listening to problems and ideas and clearly articulating solutions
  • Collaborating with HR Operations, Talent, and the rest of the People Team to share information, and develop action plans for core people programming such as performance management, employee relations, compensation, retention, talent attraction, and onboarding strategies
  • Collecting employee feedback and determining follow up actions from engagement surveys, exit interviews, and other feedback forums
  • Owning leadership development initiatives including creating toolkits and developing and delivering leadership training
  • Building and facilitating meaningful programs for the organization
  • Supporting the People team on various other initiatives as required

About You

You’re passionate about being part of a growing company and working deeply with the business to recommend people strategies that complement the business needs.  You’re a keen problem solver.  You think outside the box to find dynamic solutions. You listen very well, you have high empathy and emotional intelligence, and understand the complexities of supporting the people strategy in a fast-paced organization. You are relationship-driven and have a proven track record of gaining credibility quickly.  You recognize the importance of culture and growth in a tech environment.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • CHRP or CHRL designation
  • 7+ years experience in the people function, at least 2-5 years working in a Business Partner Capacity
  • Proven experience coaching and consulting with managers at all levels of the organization to align people strategies with business priorities
  • Diverse experience in a variety of environments and situations, providing People support and advice through the best of times and the worst
  • Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal
  • High empathy and emotional intelligence with high business acumen
  • Strong technical skills and ability to learn new programs
  • Creative problem solver
  • Self-starter and able to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Resourceful, adaptable and strong team player

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Production Supervisor
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position: Production Supervisor         

Location: Kitchener, Ontario              

Experience: 5+ Years of relevant work experience

Education: Diploma in a related field

Division: Clearpath Robotics

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job

As Production Supervisor, you will be the first point of contact for all robot builders. Communication skills are utmost important in your day to day activities. You will have a strong understanding of manufacturing priorities, and will ensure the team is operating smoothly and effectively collaborating. Ultimately, you should lead by a good example and engage the team to achieve department goals. This position will include leading the assembly teams for our  Clearpath Robotics platforms.

Responsibilities: 

  • Day-to-day direction and supervision of all robot builders.
  • Manage kit deliveries, shortage status, blockers, production flow and tasks for all product lines.
  • Provide encouragement to team members, including communicating team goals and identifying areas for new training or skill checks.
  • Completing 1:1 meetings, and performance reviews for direct reports.
  • Generate detailed reports about team performance, strategic initiatives, and deadlines.
  • Work with manufacturing engineers to ensure benches, tooling, and work instructions are up to date.
  • Champion & implement continuous improvement initiatives in all production areas.
  • Promote and ensure a safe work environment; investigate safety concerns and take appropriate action to maintain the health and safety of department personnel. 5S audits and housekeeping.
  • Ensure and maintain quality procedures and standards are consistently followed, and take effective corrective actions to remediate any manufacturing deficiencies.
  • Ensure the team enters accurate and actionable data, and maintain production jobs in our ERP system
  • Organize the repair and routine maintenance of production tools and equipment.
  • Step in to assist robot builds when required

Qualifications:

  • Strong interpersonal skills to allow efficient communication with team members, management and engineers.
  • Critical thinking and analytical skills.
  • Mechanical aptitude.
  • Able to work independently.
  • Able to read technical drawings and interpret BOMs.
  • Good understanding of products and their required process steps, including assembly and other sub-assembly processes a plus.
  • Excellent computer skills.
  • Excellent written language and verbal communication skills.

 At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Robot Builder - DAY SHIFT
item.description:
Description

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About the Job:

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require a handy individual to take charge of assembling a variety of different platforms and ensuring that we perpetually strive for a higher level of quality. We need a Robot Builder to take responsibility in assembling our core products along with their accessories.

You will contribute to a team dedicated to seeing a robotic platform from start to finish. Additionally, when you are not wrenchin’ down screws, you will be tasked with maintaining the organization and cleanliness of the production area.

This position requires the worker to be on site for the full daily shift. There is no opportunity to work from home. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Electromechanical Assembly of robotic platforms 
    • Use of hand tools
    • Use of hoisting equipment
    • Cable installation and wire routing
  • Rotating throughout different assembly stations to achieve cross-training among team members
  • Ensuring your workspace follows 5S guidelines
  • Using a computer for work instructions via VKS system
  • Production area maintenance
  • Production equipment maintenance
  • Other duties as assigned

About You:

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  

Required Skills:

  • Experience working on manual product assembly
  • Wiring or cable installation experience preferred
  • Hands-on experience with common tools, eg, screwdriver, hammer, and electric drills.
  • Practical knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and GSuite
  • Able to work the Day shift Hours 7am - 3pm Monday to Friday
  • Positive and professional attitude with safety mindset
  • Proven ability to work independently
  • Experience working with ERP systems is an asset.
  • Ability to follow written assembly work instructions in English
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs comfortably 

Bonus points for:

  • Hobbies that involve working with power tools, woodworking for instance
  • Hobbies that involve assembly with hand tools, car maintenance for instance
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • Continuous Improvement Process
  • 5S methodology
  • Previously being part of a Health & Safety Committee

What’s in it for you:

  • Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Corporate discounts and Group Insurance (home and auto)
  • Free snacks to keep you energized during the shift!
  • Cool company events such as BBQs and other celebrations including occasional food trucks at the facilities
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Friendly and fun co-workers!

item.title: Content Marketing Coordinator
item.description:
Description

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

 

About the Opportunity:

OTTO Motors is looking for a Content Marketing Coordinator to join our mighty team. In this role, you’ll help manage OTTO Motors’ content calendar and develop assets at every stage of the buyer journey from thought leadership at TOFU all the way down to technical pieces in BOFU that are intended to educate late-stage prospects, partners and customers. Your main goal will be to support a content plan that will engage and keep prospects converting throughout the funnel.

Reporting to the Manager, Demand Generation and working closely with leaders across the organization, especially the Director of Product Marketing, you’ll play a key role in driving short and long-form content at a time when content is at the center of our new verticalization strategy.

Responsibilities:

  •  Effectively help level up OTTO Motors’ content calendar (blogs, eBooks, one pagers, guides, emails, newsletters, presentations, video scripts and photography).
  • Support OTTO Motors’ content pillars; you should have command of market and industry trends, enjoy being creative and understand how to develop content for all stages of the funnel: top, middle, and bottom.
  • Leverage internal experts on the Product, Engineering and Services teams as well as external subject matter experts, influencers, advisors, and customers to create technical content that is engaging, informative, and useful.
  • Repurpose content in multiple formats, including webpages, blogs, and videos in partnership with other members of the marketing team.
  • Ensure all content aligns with the FY23 content calendar and content pillars
  • Liaise with external vendors to complete content pieces (graphic designers, content vendors)

What You Bring to the Role:

  • BSc/BA or diploma in marketing, communications, or equivalent
  • Exceptional communication and writing skills
  • Passionate about writing and creating content in many forms 
  • Keen on tracking engagement and conversion metrics to understand how the content resonates with the intended audience
  • Self-starter who is curious enough about our market and prospects and wants to figure out which content is most valuable to them
  • Confidence in your own writing and editing
  • Well-organized and detail oriented
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high change environment
What\'s In It for you?
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexibility in location (hybrid or remote work across Ontario)
  • Flexibility in hours (core hours 10am-3pm EST)
  • Comprehensive benefits, including wellness days
  • Perks to help set home office
  • Opportunity to make a difference in the supply chain!
  • Fun and friendly co-workers :) 

At OTTO we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Logistics Coordinator
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Title:            Logistics Coordinator
Location:     Kitchener, Ontario
Term:           Full-Time
Education:   College Diploma
Experience: 0+ years of relevant work experience
Salary:         $22/hr
Other:          G or G2 driver’s license and access to a vehicle


About OTTO Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

As OTTO Motors grows exponentially, so does the need to receive, handle materials, package, and ship robots. You are adaptable. Where others see barriers, you see opportunities for improvement. No day is the same - curveballs won’t make you break a sweat! This position offers the best mix of responsibility, challenge, and enjoyment. We need someone to come in, take charge, and help keep our materials and shipments moving smoothly.

Reporting into our Logistics Lead, as our Logistics Coordinator you will wear many hats, work with every department in our company, and be around robots that are paving the way for the material handling revolution. 

This position requires the employee to be on site for the full day shift. There is no opportunity to work from home. The performance of duties in this position will require the candidate to travel locally (within Kitchener-Waterloo) to our various locations. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Sign for and unload packages from couriers, inspect for visual damage.
  • Sign for and unload trucks using a forklift or reach truck
  • Receiving Purchase orders in a timely and efficient manner.
  • Put parts away in their proper locations
  • Timely execution of Pick and ship spare parts orders
  • Print Pick lists and kit items to support production
  • Ensure the Shortage Report is accurate and up to date.
  • Quote and arrange small package/LTL shipments to international and domestic customers.
  • Packing shipments large and small
  • Assist with the coordination of logistics for off-site demonstrations, events and trade shows worldwide.
  • Maintain our ERP system to ensure it reflects accuracy during transactions (Receiving, Inventory Transfer, Kitting and shipping).
  • Working closely with Production, Purchasing, and Client Success teams, to improve inter-departmental cooperation and effectiveness.
  • Other duties as assigned.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required Skills:

  • Detail-oriented and exceptionally organized.
  • Experience with Microsoft Excel, Word.
  • Comfortable navigating a computer and using software tools
  • Able to quickly evaluate and assess a problem situation and prioritize courses of action.
  • Able to work under pressure and tight deadlines.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
  • Must be a team player and self-motivated.
  • Able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds

Bonus points for: 

  • Being an H.T.S code whiz!
  • Previous forklift and/or reach truck experience.
  • Comfortable using pallet jacks.
  • Experience with shipping freight domestically/internationally using UPS and FedEx.
  • Experience working with EPR systems and/or JIRA.
  • Familiar with inventory/cycle counting, finding root causes and solving discrepancies.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.
