item.title: Technical Deployment Specialist
item.description:
Description

Position:              Technical Deployment Specialist 
Location:             Kitchener
Experience:        3+ years
Education:          Bachelors in relevant field
Division:              OTTO Motors

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The primary objective of the Technical Deployment Specialist (TDS) role is to act as the technical point of contact for a project during the deployment phase. Reporting to the Manager of the Project Management Office (PMO), the Technical Deployment Specialist works closely with the assigned Project Manager (PM) to ensure the technical deployment of a project goes as smoothly as possible. The Technical Deployment Specialist tracks and resolves technical issues and acts as Tier 1 support for both the Systems Engineer and the Project Manager assigned to the project. The Technical Deployment Specialist is the technical bridge/universal translator between the Project Manager and the OTTO Motors Engineering team.

Responsibilities of the Technical Deployment Specialist include:
  • Supplement the project ‘voice of the customer’ at the technical level.
  • Work with the Project Managers and Systems Engineers to plan and deploy projects after receiving a PO and leading up to and including a Site Acceptance Test.
  • Gain a broad exposure to all aspects of the OTTO Motors technology and interact effectively with varied departments.
  • Gain a working knowledge of the processes and workflows of the PMO and those of other OTTO Motors teams.
  • Have a familiarity with and understand the principal functions of all information systems used at OTTO Motors: Epicor, Jira, Salesforce, Elastic/Kibana, Wiki, Google Suite, OTTO Motors Knowledge Base, Arena/PLM.
  • Understand the basics of: AMR SW, AMR HW, Infrastructure (Fleet Manager SW, IT policies, Networking), Product capabilities/limitations, and best practices for all current and recent past products.
  • Troubleshoot issues with any of the aforementioned topics quickly and effectively, escalating in a timely manner when an issue requires a solution from a SME.
  • Assist with robot diagnostic data collection and primary triage for root cause analysis or escalation to Tier III or Tier IV support.
  • Reduce the number of \'direct-to-engineering\' escalations arising from on-site issues; this lets the developers focus on new features without getting distracted by minor issues.
  • Collaborate with OTTO Motors Engineering to troubleshoot project issues.
  • Pre-configure Fleet Manager OVA\'s (installation files) for deployment at customer sites and assist with issues arising during the installation process.
  • Act as primary IT/network SME on active deployments and assigned upgrades.
  • Keep track of the state of multiple project assignments at any given time, and maintain information records for each, from kickoff to handoff.
  • Self-prioritize workloads, often when under multiple \'crisis\' situations at customer sites.
  • Communicate effectively with SMEs, other OTTO Motors employees (of varying levels of technical expertise) and with the customer.
  • Translating high-level technical concepts into easy-to-understand terms.
  • Prepare technical documentation about each deployment to facilitate the transition from the deployment phase to the support phase.
  • Understand the product capabilities and limitations and explain the context of each to different parties, including internal to OTTO Motors.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required skills:

  • Previous experience in a technical customer facing role
  • College diploma in engineering or other technical field
  • Excellent organizational skills with a demonstrated ability to prioritize and analyze difficult issues
  • Strong negotiation and communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a fast-paced high mix low volume environment
  • Ability to work unsupervised while still effectively achieving goals
  • Strong technical aptitude and ability to learn new skills and tools
  • Background or exposure to an industrial automation environment
  • Proven ability to work cooperatively with others in a team environment
  • Technical writing/communication

 
At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Product Marketing Manager (Hybrid or Remote - North America)
item.description:
Description

Position:         Product Marketing Manager (Hybrid or Remote)
Location:        Kitchener, Ontario or Remote/Virtual (North America)
Experience:    5+ years
Education:      Bachelor’s degree
Division:         OTTO Motors
Type:              Full-Time Permanent

Clearpath Robotics Inc.develops the future of robotics technology through the development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Research Division and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About OTTO Motors

OTTO Motors is the industrial division of Clearpath Robotics. OTTO Motors provides self-driving technology for material handling inside manufacturing facilities and warehouses. OTTO is trusted for mission-critical deliveries spanning the most demanding of industrial environments. recognized brands such as GE, Toyota, and Nestle trust their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors.

About our Opportunity

The global market for mobile robotics is expected to exceed $224 billion by 2030, according to global technology market advisory firm ABI Research. OTTO Motors is at the center of this enormous market growth fueled by a changing workforce and the growing need for business continuity within the supply chain.

The Product Marketing Manager is a critical team member and is responsible for internally and externally communicating OTTO Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMRs) value proposition, product-market fit, and competitive positioning. As a key partner with product management, marketing, and sales teams, the Product Marketing Manager is the point person who develops and refines product positioning and implements the product marketing plan across internal and external vehicles.  With a passion for understanding the voice of the customer and translating product features to customer benefits, the candidate will help drive OTTO’s market leadership position.  The ideal candidate will have a background in Industry 4.0 areas like Automation and Robotics, in addition to emerging automation trends for material handling in manufacturing and 3PL segments.

As a Product Marketing Manager, you will:

  • Collaborate with product management and marketing communications to develop product positioning and messaging that resonates with our target buyer personas. Develop associated tools and supporting collateral to enable sales and marketing teams.
  • Prime the launch of new products and updates to existing products through our customer-facing channels, including managing the cross-functional implementation of the launch plan.
  • Lead development of marketing plans for OTTO Motors’ products with cross-functional teams for both new and existing products, from strategy to tactical initiatives. Manage the cross-functional implementation of the plan.
  • Document, measure, and optimize the buyer journey linking discovery through to the ‘why’ behind the purchase and beyond. Drive subsequent enhancements through our marketing and sales messaging and engagement.
  • Support the development of product messaging content such as case studies, videos, website copy, and blog posts
  • Create internal and customer-facing competitive positioning

You come ready with:

  • 5+ years of marketing experience, B2B technology marketing
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or related field
  • Experience in a product marketing capacity developing marketing plans and customer value proposition messaging supporting both new and existing products
  • Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority, in particular, influencing and working collaboratively with sales, marketing, and product management
  • Experience working in fast-paced technology companies with demonstrated experience launching products and services, scale-ups preferred
  • Proven expertise simplifying complex information and clearly and concisely communicating information verbally and in print
  • Product marketing background in B2B technology solutions, ideally in Industry 4.0 topics
  • Experience with OTTO Motors’ target market and customer base - manufacturers and 3PLs, including an understanding of what happens in factories, warehouses, and distribution centers.

What’s In It for You?

  • Flexibility in where you work (fully remote, hybrid, or office-based)
  • Flexibility in when you work, core hours are 10 am - 3 pm EST
  • Group Benefits, including EAP and Wellness Days
  • Additional perks to get you set up at home/office
  • Opportunity to make a difference with the worlds’ deadliest, dirtiest and dangerous jobs
  • Amazing co-workers to laugh and have fun
  • Enjoy advancing the future of robotics!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior Software Product Manager (Hybrid/Remote - North America)
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position:             Senior Software Product Manager

Location:            Kitchener, Ontario or Remote/Virtual Canada

Experience:        5+ Years of relevant work experience

Education:          Undergraduate degree (Business, Engineering, CS, Surprise us!)

Division:              OTTO Motors

Type:                   Full-Time Permanent

About Us

Clearpath provides self-driving vehicle technology and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s industrial and research divisions: OTTO Motors and Clearpath Robotics.

OTTO Motors designs, manufactures and operates self-driving vehicles for busy factories and warehouses. You’ll find an empowering environment where job titles don’t matter, people leave their egos at the door, everyone works really hard to get things done and we tackle hard problems head-on. We employ passionate and highly talented professionals who are looking to push the envelope and help us achieve our ultimate goal: to put an OTTO in every factory in the world.

 

About the Opportunity:

We are looking for a senior software product manager to add to our growing team. We need someone with a track record of success bringing great products to market. An ideal candidate has experience bringing enterprise-grade software to market, comes from an automation background or really understands the industrial automation, manufacturing, or distribution space.

 

You will be responsible for a critical part of our portfolio in material movement and your experience in product management will help you drive the products’ success. You will work closely with the rest of the OTTO product development team to make sure that we are delivering properly engineered solutions. You will work closely with both sales and marketing to ensure your products are competitive, valuable and understood in the marketplace.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to product strategy, vision, and execution of our software to ensure the health, well-being and happiness of our robots.
  • Build a detailed near- and long-term product roadmap. Validate with key customers and stakeholders.
  • Translate software requirements into product deliverables and drive them to completion
  • Work closely with the engineering team to deliver great software solutions
  • Act as a product evangelist internally and externally champion the best in class material movement platform
  • Be the expert on the competition and how to beat them.

Required Experience/Skills:

Product Managers come from various backgrounds, therefore, most importantly we are looking for someone who matches the description above and is looking to take on the world. That being said we consider these baselines for our next team member:

  • You have been building software products for a while and have 5+ years’ experience shipping products as a product manager
  • You have a degree or diploma in Business or Engineering related fields
  • You have worked with engineering teams as a product owner and have demonstrable experience leading cross-functional teams to define, execute and iterate on projects
  • You are adept at both verbal and visual communication and can lead teams through difficult decisions.
  • You have a demonstrable track record shipping high-quality product, and can excel in product design when required
  • You can break down strategy into tactics and tactics into metrics

What’s in it for you:

  • Meaningfully contribute to a compelling vision
  • Work-life balance (flexible hours)
  • Competitive compensation
  • Health benefits
  • Career development
  • Equity 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Systems Integrator/Engineer
item.description:
Description

Position:            Senior Systems Engineer
Location:           South-Western Ontario           
Education:         College Diploma / University Degree in an Engineering Discipline
Division:             OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • understanding customer requirements and ensuring clarity of all requirements prior to proceeding with the detailed design;
  • consulting with applications engineering during the requirements and concept definition process; documenting/updating the requirements when needed
  • detailed design & integration of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes design of the workflow as well as the communications required from our system to any third party automation systems in the facility where the system is being installed
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above

Additional responsibilities include:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~30 - 40 % travel commitment (NOTE: No travel outside of North America currently with the COVID-19 travel restrictions)

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

As an experienced Systems Engineer you believe that the final product is more than the sum of its component parts and live in this area of optimising the intersection of the components. You are no stranger to the intricacies of engineering compromise and the need to consider all aspects of the whole when crafting the ultimate fulfillment of the system requirements. Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end user systematically.

Required background:

  • 5+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users

Required skills:

  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail
  • ability to navigate through and program PLCs
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics

Bonus for experience:

  • data analysis experience
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other
  • experience with inductive automation ignition OPC/UA software
  • familiarity of working with Linux

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Technical Support Specialist (Rotating shifts)
item.description:
Description

Position:      Technical Support Specialist (Rotating shifts)

Location:     Kitchener

Job  Type:   Full-Time Permanent

Experience: 2-5 years customer-facing work experience

Education:   Bachelors in related field

Division:      OTTO Motors 

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About OTTO Motors

OTTO Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visitwww.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath is seeking a Technical Support Specialist to join our highly skilled team in Kitchener. At Clearpath we believe that every client is a VIP and we need someone who will obsessively focus on making our customers successful.

You will be responsible for providing remote post-sales customer service and technical support to our rapidly growing list of customers globally.  Don’t worry if you encounter a complex technical challenge, we have a team of insanely smart robotics engineers (the brain surgeons of robotics!) who will help you troubleshoot.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Advanced Level technical support to our customers
  • On-call Escalation Support
  • Organizing warranty parts and repairs
  • Triage and customer assistance
  • Escalating tickets and coordinating engineering teams with support efforts
  • On-boarding new customers
  • Acting as a customer advocate internally
  • Chasing down a solution internally to a deployed customers issue
  • Supporting our partners deploying systems at new customer sites

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.   Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Client-facing Skills:

  • 2-5 years customer-facing work experience
  • Strong communicator (written and verbal), with excellent phone and email manners
  • Naturally friendly, energetic and empathetic personality
  • Well organized and responsive, with great problem solving and negotiation skills
  • Passionate about making people happy through exceptional service
  • Basic grasp of technology and robotics
  • Solid grasp of software architecture, and IT systems
  • Communicating technical ideas in an easy to understand way

Technical Skills:

  • Hardware/Electrical hands-on troubleshooting
  • Computer networking and applicable industrial standards
  • Data analytics

Bonus points for:

  • Linux (Ubuntu), C, C++, Python
  • ROS knowledge
  • Ability to work evenings 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Account Manager - Channel Partners
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position:           Account Manager - Channel Partners    

Location: Waterloo, Ontario              

Experience:    5+ years experience

Division: Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

 

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through the development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job 

Clearpath Robotics’ Research Systems team is looking for a Account Manager - Channel Partners to develop and implement processes, materials, and solutions to empower our international reseller network. 

As our Account Manager - Channel Partners, your primary responsibilities will be to:

  • Represent Clearpath Robotics and communicate with our global VAR Partner Network to facilitate the sale of Clearpath products outside of North America
  • Provide day-to-day support for Partners to help them sell and support Clearpath systems
  • Develop and execute a sales enablement program with the goal of increasing bookings and revenue through each Partner
  • Drive requirements and help develop sales tools and materials for Partners, such as training, marketing materials, and overall enablement programs
  • Act as an internal channel advocate to ensure partner and customer satisfaction
  • Collaborate with Marketing to develop joint marketing opportunities with strategic partners (case studies, social media, etc).
  • Qualify, scope, quote, and close direct sales in your territory as appropriate
  • Be responsible for pipeline growth, bookings, and revenue growth in your territory

About You

You are a sharp, articulate and persuasive person, who is equally comfortable spending their days talking to business leaders and engineers. You dream of being part of a close-knit sales team that embraces new challenges with a bear hug and thrives equally on collaboration and friendly competition.

Our ideal candidate is someone who friends describe as:

  • A Collaborator - Someone who likes to enable partner companies to win, consistently
  • Entrepreneurial and resourceful
  • A confident and articulate speaker with the ability to think on their feet
  • Dynamic, dependable, and diligent.
  • Able to see both sides of a situation and work towards a mutually beneficial solution

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 5+ years experience 
  • Proven success in Business Development, Direct Sales and/or Account Management
  • Experience in international sales
  • Experience developing and implementing strategic processes and programs
  • Ability to travel 10% of the time
  • Experience with CRM such as Salesforce

Bonus points:

  • Technical degree
  • Understanding of machinery / or complex systems

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: General Application
item.description: Don\'t see a role for you? Please complete the form below to share your interest in Borealis AI!

item.title: Junior Graphic Designer
item.description:
Available Locations
Vancouver

What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an enthusiastic candidate to fill our Junior Graphic Designer position on a year-long contract. With the opportunity to work cross-functionally with team members across all our offices and functions, this role will support all visual design needs for Borealis AI. As a member of the Operations team, you will be joining a group that believes in being Bold & Curious, so we are looking for someone who is creative, eager to learn and looking to make an impact! 

Your responsibilities include:

  • Collaborating with our Senior Visual Designer to provide cross-functional design support on all visual design needs;
  • Supporting operations, marketing, partnership, and product teams with creative ideation;
  • Designing and preparing artwork for print and digital applications;
  • Designing PowerPoints and Word Documents;
  • Adhering to brand style guides and templates;
  • Typesetting;
  • Formatting files;
  • Attention to detail;
  • Maintaining a well-organized artwork filling system;
  • Effectively managing timelines and your workload to ensure tasks stay on schedule.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • Recent graduate in; graphic design, multi-media design, fine arts, web design, UX design, product design or related field;
  • Experience in an internship or entry-level graphic design role;
  • Experience working with Adobe Creative Suite. Particularly InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop;
  • Experience in Microsoft PowerPoint and Word;
  • Ability to work efficiently and accurately with minimal supervision;
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills;
  • Great communication skills;
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize workload to meet deadlines;
  • Nice-to-have: Understanding of basic web design and HTML/CSS coding;
  • Nice-to-have: Motion graphics/video editing education or experience.

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

item.title: Machine Learning Engineering Lead
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an Engineering Manager to lead our Equities Returns Prediction team, being at the forefront of machine learning technology and working on extremely challenging problems. 

 

As a Machine Learning Engineering Lead, you’ll be responsible for owning and delivering a project end to end – everything from data pre-processing to implementing machine learning training pipelines and deploying inference in a production environment. You’ll be directly managing a team of machine learning engineers, responsible for strategic planning, execution and delivery. You will provide your team with technical leadership and mentorship. You will work along other engineering leads across Borealis AI. As a people manager you will be responsible for growing your team and fostering career growth of the engineers. 

Your responsibilities include:

  • Lead and directly manage a team of engineers, being responsible for planning execution and delivery of ML systems; 
  • Establish high standards and share knowledge in performance, scalability, enterprise system architecture, and engineering best practices; 
  • Establish and maintain collaboration with research and business teams to converge on the best solutions; 
  • Extending prototypes into fully functional, polished solutions ready for internal and/or external use; 
  • Grow and develop the team, helping each team member advance in their career. 

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • Have 7+ years of experience delivering software projects to production; 
  • Have experience managing a team of engineers; 
  • Have experience developing modular, robust, scalable software in a modern programming language; 
  • Experience working with business, product and other technical teams; 
  • Experience with scaling and performance of large systems; 
  • Have led the full lifecycle of software product development including the successful deployment of products to production; 
  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software products, fostering career growth of software engineers, and establishing software engineering best practices within your team; 
  • Have background in machine learning or a related field; 
  • Experience with Capital Markets or any financial domain is a big plus. 

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential; 
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable; 
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities; 
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale. 

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

item.description:

As a Machine Learning Researcher, you’re looking to channel your love of playing with real-world data into industry-disrupting solutions. We\'re a lab that supports research on a wide variety of theoretical and applied machine learning projects. Working in our lab will grant you unique access to massive structured and unstructured datasets with the tools and resources necessary to build game-changing statistical models.

 

Being part of our team means you’ll also have the opportunity to publish original research in peer-reviewed academic journals and participate in conferences around the world, such as NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR and more.

item.title: Machine Learning Researcher - Time Series
item.description:
What\'s the Opportunity?

Capital markets are known for their complex dynamics and intricate dependencies. As a Machine Learning Researcher in our capital markets team, you’re looking to channel your love of playing with real-world data into industry-disrupting solutions. Our team supports research on a wide variety of theoretical and applied machine learning projects, including game-changing studies on dynamic interactions between statistical models operating on a common source of data.

 

Working in capital markets will grant you unique access to massive structured and unstructured datasets with the tools and resources necessary to drive your vision. Being part of our team means you’ll also have the opportunity to publish original research in peer-reviewed academic journals and participate in conferences around the world, such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AISTATS and more.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Developing novel AI solutions that facilitate impactful products;
  • Conducting original, publishable research by advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning techniques;
  • Working with the development team to transfer research work into production;
  • Interpreting larger organizational needs and designing algorithmic solutions that can drive the next generation of banking experiences;
  • Identifying relevant new AI technologies as they become available, and disseminating them into the bank’s technology capabilities.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A PhD in a sub-area of AI or demonstrated research track record by means of publications;
  • A passion for solving open problems in areas such as time-series analysis, generative modelling, graph-based architectures, or multi-agent systems;
  • Proficiency in Python and Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow or PyTorch.
  • An eye for efficiency and experience with large-scale optimization on large-scale data.
  • [Bonus] Familiarity with C++ and network programming.
  • [Bonus] Familiarity with market microstructure, alpha research, or game theory.

item.title: Machine Learning Software Engineer
item.description:
Available Locations
Toronto

What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an enthusiastic software developer who’s excited by the opportunity of being at the forefront of machine learning technology, and working on extremely challenging problems. As a Machine Learning Software Engineer, you’ll be responsible for owning and delivering a project end to end – everything from literature review and data pre-processing to implementing machine learning algorithms and front-end development.

At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, has access to rich and massive datasets, and offers the computational resources to support ongoing development in areas such as reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning and computer vision. You can find out more about our research areas at borealisai.com.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Building machine learning-based software solutions for solving important problems;
  • Prototyping solutions to evaluate the impact of selected algorithms on the target problem;
  • Collaborating with research and business teams to converge on the best solutions;
  • Optimizing algorithms and prototypical solutions for efficient implementation;
  • Extending prototypes into fully functional, polished solutions ready for internal and/or external use;
  • Supporting projects with thorough documentation of usage, design decisions and capabilities;
  • Extracting, transforming and loading massive datasets using distributed computing framework technologies (Hadoop, Spark, etc.);

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent.  A master’s or PhD in an AI sub-field is an asset;
  • 2+ years of software development experience (including co-op and internships) in a high-responsibility, minimal-supervision environment;
  • Experience with writing modular, robust, scalable software in one of the major languages such as C++, C#, Java, Python 3.x;
  • Familiarity with the Unix command line and bash scripting;
  • Experience with Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow, Theano, Keras and PyTorch is an asset;
  • Exposure to distributed computing frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark) as well as SQL, NoSQL and graph databases;
  • Demonstrated experience in two or more of the following areas: Traditional Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, Time-Series Analysis, Computer Vision, Reinforcement Learning;
  • Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including testing methods, coding standards, code reviews and source control management.

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

item.title: Research Engineer
item.description:
Borealis AI is a team of researchers and developers dedicated to solving today’s leading problems in machine learning and artificial intelligence. Our researchers are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of theoretical and applied science, while our development team transforms state-of-the-art technologies and algorithms into impactful products with the potential to reach millions of people.


We’re looking for an enthusiastic scientists or software developer who’s excited by the opportunity of being at the forefront of applying machine learning technology to challenging problems. As a Research Engineer, you’ll be part of a collaborative team delivering AI projects end to end – everything from data pre-processing and exploration, to prototyping novel algorithmic solutions, to software implementations of machine learning-based products. You will function as a bridge between research and development teams to help extend research prototypes into implemented products.


At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, has access to rich and massive datasets, and offers the computational resources to support ongoing development in areas such as reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning and computer vision.


Your responsibilities include:

  • Building machine learning-based software solutions;

  • Collaborating with researchers to prototype machine-learning solutions rapidly;

  • Conducting comparisons to existing algorithms and baselines;

  • Reviewing, extending, and optimizing prototype solutions;

  • Collaborating with the engineering team to integrate algorithms into products;

  • Developing reusable internal tools to facilitate research prototyping; and

  • Supporting projects with thorough documentation, design decisions, and capabilities.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A master’s or PhD degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, economics or equivalent
  • 2+ years of applied machine learning experience in a high-responsibility, minimal-supervision environment;
  • Experience with writing modular, robust, scalable software in one of the major languages such as Python 3.x, C++, or Julia;
  • Familiarity with the Unix command line and bash scripting;
  • Experience in the following areas: deep learning, time series, monte carlo simulations, PDEs, derivative pricing;
  • Experience with deep learning packages such as PyTorch, Keras, and Tensorflow;
  • Exposure to distributed computing using CPUs and GPUs;
  • Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including testing methods, coding standards, code reviews, and source control management; and
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative attitude.

What’s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

item.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineering Lead
item.description:
Available Locations
Montreal

What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for a Senior Engineering Manager to lead our Montreal engineering team, working at the forefront of machine learning technology and working on extremely challenging problems. 

 

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineering Lead, you will manage a team of managers and engineers involved in multiple ML projects.  You will support those projects through the entire lifecycle—from research experimentation through to implementing applications and solutions and deploying them to production.  You will provide your team with technical leadership, mentorship and guidance. You will work along other senior managers in engineering and across Borealis AI to help achieve our strategic goals. As a people manager you will be responsible for growing your team and fostering their career development and growth.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Provide strategic direction, leadership and management to a team of managers and engineers involved in multiple ML projects
  • Provide functional management to multiple ML projects
  • Establish high standards and share technical knowledge in performance, scalability, system architecture, and engineering best practices; 
  • Establish and maintain collaboration with research and business teams to converge on the best solutions; 
  • Grow and develop the team, helping each team member advance their career development.
  • Work with Borealis senior leadership to achieve the Borealis mission and strategy
  • Drive cross-team cohesion and help to build the culture of the Montreal office

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • Have 12+ years of experience delivering software projects to production; 
  • Have 7+ years experience managing engineering teams; 
  • Experience working collaboratively with business, product and other technical teams; 
  • Have led the full lifecycle of software product development including the successful deployment of products to production; 
  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software products, fostering career growth of software engineers, and establishing software engineering best practices within your team; 
  • Experience working in an agile environment, including managing team members across multiple different projects and/or products
  • Experience managing hybrid teams; promote an excellent employee experience regardless of where employees are
  • Have a background in machine learning or a related field; 
  • Experience with financial services and enterprise software.

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;

item.description:
Available Locations
Toronto

What\'s the opportunity?

As a Senior Product Manager on the Product team, you’ll get a chance to lead the development of a state-of-the-art AI product for the financial services industry. You and the cross-functional project team will be responsible for discovering, building and delivering a product that solves a high-impact business problem. You will also be responsible for defining the long-term product strategy, roadmap, and objectives to lead your team towards a product vision that supports both Borealis AI’s and RBC strategic directions.

 

At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading machine learning researchers and software developers. Our mission is to think big and go beyond what’s possible today to deliver competitive advantage to RBC through AI product development. This is a rare opportunity to build the skills required to make machine learning work in the enterprise.

 

Your responsibilities include:

  • Leading the development and delivery of machine learning products within Personal and Commercial Banking;
  • Defining and executing on both short and long-term product strategy and roadmaps;
  • Defining and delivering POCs and scaling them into full-fledged products;
  • Optimizing products to rapidly improve and scale across the bank
  • Leading and coaching a small team of product managers
  • Building and maintaining relationships with senior stakeholders within RBC.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • You have 7+ years of experience working in a product role;
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are a strong leader with the ability to own a product end-to-end independently, with a track record of successful product deliveries;
  • You are well versed in the core areas of applied machine learning and have experience with machine learning platforms and deploying models at scale;
  • You have managed, mentored, and/or coached product managers in past roles;
  • You are an experienced team leader who can guide a cross-functional team to successful delivery;
  • You are a strong collaborator and have the ability to influence both technical and business stakeholders;
  • You have experience working in banking, financial services, or fintech;
  • You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

item.title: Technical Recruiter
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity? 

Borealis AI’s mission is to be a leader in AI for financial services and world-class talent is at the heart of this vision.  We are looking for an experienced Technical Recruiter to support our recruitment objectives, including creatively sourcing, managing the candidate lifecycle, and closing candidates.

 

This is a great opportunity for someone looking to gain experience in a cutting-edge industry of AI/ML, who wants to be part of an innovative organization. You will have the opportunity to partner with hiring managers across our labs, working together
to find the best talent to support us in achieving our goals. Our team believes in being Bold & Curious, so we are looking for someone who is creative, eager to learn and looking to make an impact!

Your responsibilities include:

  • Partnering with business leaders and hiring managers to assess their talent requirements and advising on the best hiring strategy; 
  • Using a variety of techniques to discover and attract the best passive talent; 
  • Conducting interviews and phone screens to assess both technical baseline, as well as skills to be successful in the Borealis AI environment; 
  • Focusing on providing a great candidate experience at every opportunity; 
  • Constantly evaluating our processes and pipeline to ensure we are fairly evaluating candidates;   
  • Ensure the ATS (Greenhouse) and recruitment reporting is regularly updated to aid with metrics i.e. sources, agency against direct, time to hire, time to offer, average cost per hire, etc; 
  • Drive specific D&I activity/initiatives for recruiting by upskilling hiring managers on best practice and ensuring data is tracked successfully.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have: 

  • Minimum of 2+ years of technical recruiting experience; 
  • Demonstrated track record of excellence in sourcing and assessing technical talent; 
  • Proven relationship management experience with hiring teams and internal stakeholders, helping them navigate the sources of talent, and assisting them with assessment; 
  • Skilled in offer negotiation, awareness of pertinent employment legislation, and employment market trends; 
  • The ability to lead requisitions to successful conclusion – balancing efficiency with quality; 
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills; 
  • A genuine interest in the technology industry as shown by continuous learning throughout your career; 
  • Experience in a start-up, fast-paced environment;   
  • Experience with engineering, research and product roles would be a benefit. 

What’s in it for you? 

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
