item.title: SAP BW Specialist
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters.

Join us!

This role is responsible to produce SAP BW solution blueprints, functional design specifications, and is accountable for overall solution designs. The role will also be responsible for end-to-end development, testing, documentation, implementation, and support of reporting applications in BW.  The person can provide estimates based on clear requirements and assumptions.  This person may be deployed in either a Project, Enhancement/Evolution, and/or Support capacity, depending on demand.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES 
 

  • Provide/verify work estimates.
  • Produce design specifications, including detailed functional design specifications (as required), and any relevant artefacts/supporting documents, that meet the business requirements, aligning with the solution architecture, and overall enterprise architecture.
  • As required, guide, and collaborate with, the application developer/designers and/or other configurator/designers on the configuration and functional designs.  Address any potential design development issues with them.
  • Produce test cases/scenarios and prepare test data to test all functionality identified in the functional design. Conduct unit, functional and integration testing, and log results.
  • Diagnose and resolve configuration defects through root-cause analysis and impact analysis.  Determine whether redesign is required for proper resolution.  Change the design specifications when applicable.
  • Define detailed implementation plans, including deployment, cutover and fall-back.  Ensure that all objects have been promoted successfully to the production environment, and overall landscape integrity is maintained.
  • Guide and execute the knowledge transfer to the support teams as per the knowledge transfer plan.
  • Apply, and ensure compliance with, all appropriate CN IT standards (ie. Security, Architecture, Project Delivery Methodology, SOX, etc.)

 
REQUIREMENTS 
 

  • College degree required
  • Strong knowledge of SAP BW data modeling and design (minimum of 7 years experience)
  • Strong knowledge of BW ETL process
  • Strong knowledge of BW reporting tools (ie: BEx, Business Objects, MDX, Design Studio)
  • Strong knowledge of ABAP (3-5 years experience)
  • Good understanding of ECC processes in (FI, CO, MM, SD, PM, QM, HR)
  • Experience with testing practices, frameworks, and tools.
  •  Experience in Development Practices and proven methodologies (Agile, Iterative, Waterfall)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite of Applications, and Office 365

PROFILE 
 

  • Leadership attributes, self-starter, and ability to multi-task
  • Customer-focused, business-facing, and results-driven to achieve business objectives
  • Team player, collaborative
  • Autonomous
  • Professional, detail-oriented, diligent

 
ASSETS 
 

  • Bilingual (French spoken/written)
  • Bachelor degree in related area of activity
  • Experience with BW/4HANA, S/4 HANA, BW Modeling Tools, Eclipse (Web IDE), Calculation views
  • Experience with ALM/Quality Center
  • Experience with visualization and dashboarding tools such as SAP Analysis for Microsoft Office, SAP Analytics Cloud, PowerBI, and Tableau
  • Experience with ITSM (Information Technology Service Management) platforms, more specifically, ServiceNow
  • Experience with Jira and Confluence
  • Experience with integration platforms and tools (i.e.: SSIS)
  • Experience in the Railroad industry

About CN
CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities.  The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.

 

The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation;  master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformation  requirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.

 

The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.

The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.

 

Main Responsibilities

Data Profiling and Cleansing – Data-Related Tasks on the “As-Is” Environment – 30%

Participates in data objects identification and business  rules profiling

Performs data  quality  assessment and quality  metrics reporting

Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation

Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks

 

Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the “To-Be” Environment – 40%

Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures

Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms

Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks

 

Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements – 30%

Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners

Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems

Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms

Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation

Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape

 

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.

 

Requirements

Experience

Managing and Handling Enterprise Data

Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data

Education/Certification/Designation

Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or  Engineering*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

 

Competencies

Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

Applies analytical thinking

Innovates through problem solving

Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

Demonstrates organizational abilities

Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

Works independently with little supervision

 

Technical Skills/Knowledge

Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.

Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*

Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*

Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes

Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets

Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools

Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)

Ability to present and communicate results clearly

Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

 

Organizational Impact

Decision Making & Impacts

The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle

 

Level of Interaction/Influence

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations. 

Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.

 

 

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

 

CN requires that all employees in Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

 

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Specialist Solution and System Integration/ LAB
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Specialist Solution and System Integration is responsible for the successful deployment of advanced infrastructure, telecom, Internet, Industrial IoT, software development, applications and technology solutions, systems and services. The Specialist ensures that team members and projects meet all business requirements, and contributes to the global evolution of CN’s I&T. The Specialist plays a key role in the team, ensuring that the technology delivered is secure, reliable, available, resilient, performant and aligned with safety standards as per business requirements.

Main Responsibilities

Integration – 100%

Engage with customers to capture requirements

Translate technology solution architecture into technical or software development standards and specifications

Establish lab test plans, conduct tests and log results

Based on blueprint and test results in the lab, create a detailed/functional solution that meets business requirements and record them in the log book

Establish deployment/migration strategy and guide project team and operations

Travel to visit field sites and inspect installations, as required

Guide other integrators and work with them to address potential and current problems

Coordinate installation with technicians in the field and the owner while taking into account maintenance windows

Determine appropriate solution for support issues during project migration or deployment through root cause and impact analysis

Lead transition-to-core operations: update documentation, systems, training and presentation

Define and ensure adherence to engineering and configuration standards

Implement and ensure compliance with all appropriate CN I&T standards (e.g., security, architecture, project delivery methods, SOX, telecom, software engineering, etc.)

Engage external providers and work with business planning, supply management and legal teams in the context of procuring delivery and/or support services for new or existing services

Manage the roadmap (hardware and software) with the vendor based on CN strategy and I&T technology needs

Estimate overall solution costs and share information with project managers and stakeholders

Create technical diagrams and documentation for the solution

Follow the change and release management processes by initiating change controls and executing cut-over plans

Technology and Infrastructure

Create telecom or systems integration documentation (including build books)

Identify the degree of re-use of existing infrastructure and capacity versus the need for expansion

Assist A&Q (Assessment and Qualification) in providing labour and material estimates for day-to-day requests

 

 

Working Conditions

The Specialist may be required to travel occasionally in North America. The role supports a 24/7 environment. Visits to field sites may be required for deployment activities or to attend industry events or conferences.

 

Requirements

Experience

Relevant Experience

Between 5 to 10 years of relevant work experience

Minimum 7 years of experience in a software development, telecom manufacturing, management or service provider environment

Minimum 5 years of relevant technical experience (specialty) in complex detailed design and solution integration

Experience designing, configuring and deploying telecom systems

Proven experience delivering technology projects involving multiple parties

Proven experience with IP protocols and technologies

Core Network

Experience in design and implementation of MPLS networks (RR/P/PE)

Experience with SDN technology*

Routing and Switching

Experience in design and implementation of LAN/WAN solutions

Data Centre

Experience with Cisco data centre technologies: Cisco Nexus (N9K, N7K, N5K, N2K, FabricPath, Spine and Leaf, VxLAN, QOS queuing on Nexus platforms and MPLS on Nexus)

Experience with ASR platforms: ASR1K ASR920 ME3600

Experience with LAN/WAN, data centre, edge and core platforms for business/industrial enterprises and service providers (Nexus, ISR, ASR1K, ME3600, 3850/3650, IE3000/4000, CGR2010, 2960+, etc.)

Experience with PoE/PoE+

Wi-Fi

Experience with Cisco WLC, AP Indoor and Outdoor and Cisco prime wi-fi platforms

Experience in ASR1K, ME3600, 3850/3650, IE3000/4000, CGR2010 and 2960

Telephony

Experience with PSTN access (TDM, analog, SIP Trunking), dial plans, survivability (SRST), call admission control, interactive voice response and call handlers

Experience with live service deployments and/or support of production environments

Experience with IP-PBX solutions: Mitel, Avaya or Cisco*

Experience with Microsoft collaboration solutions: Lync, SfB and Teams

Video

Experience with federation, distribution, archiving, recording, monitoring, chain of custody and regulation

Experience with video surveillance device lifecycle

Tools and systems management

Experience in design, automation and deployment of telecom systems monitoring solutions

Experience in KPIs and dashboard management

Automation

Experience developing automation in a telecom environment in one or more of the following areas: network provisioning, network management, policy compliance, quality check, reporting, testing and troubleshooting

Experience with automation frameworks, development environments and technologies related to networking: Python scripting, Ansible and Git

Experience with Agile methodology

Experience with Micro Focus network automation and Selenium*

Experience with Red Hat OpenStack*

Experience with NFV and SDN*

Radio

Experience with radio propagation software such as Pathloss and Linkplanner

Previous railroad experience in communications*

*Any experience for these above would be considered as an asset

 

Education/Certification/Designation

Bachelor’s Degree in Commerce, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent

 

Competencies

Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

Applies analytical thinking

Innovates through problem solving

Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

Demonstrates organizational abilities

Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

Works independently with little supervision

Ensures safe and secure environments

Possess organizational, time-management and prioritizing skills

Shows initiative and empowers others to raise our collective game

 

Technical Skills/Knowledge

Ability to precisely estimate efforts of the tasks assigned to integrators

Technical documentation skills

Knowledge of IT security principles

Strong systems engineering knowledge

Ability to estimate efforts and costs required for delivery

Technology and infrastructure (I and T)

Proficient in telecommunications networks and/or IT systems and software development

Proficient in IT infrastructure and telecom technologies

Core Network

Expertise in MPLS (LDP, RSVP-TE), MP-BGP and QoS

Deep knowledge of IP routing (EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, ISIS) and redistribution between routing protocols on different vendor platforms

Expertise in transmission technologies (fibre, copper, microwave)

Certification: Alcatel NRS2 and Cisco CCNP

Routing and Switching

Deep knowledge of IP routing (EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, ISIS) and redistribution between routing protocols on different vendor platforms

Basic knowledge of L2 topologies and deployment: LAN extensions, STP and native VLANs

Basic understanding of MPLS networking (LDP, MP-BGP)

Good knowledge of transmission technologies (fibre, copper, wireless)

Extensive knowledge of IP network ecosystem: DNS, DHCP, VPN, firewalls, load balancer, network acceleration, network monitoring tools, Wi-Fi and VoIP

Good understanding of technologies: RS232, T1, E&M

Data Centre

Expertise in design and implementation of LAN/WAN end-to-end solutions

Routing protocols expertise: BGP, IS-IS, EIGRP, etc.

Expertise in data centre automation (integration with VM, storage, firewall, IPAM, etc.)

Expertise in security: zoning, VLAN, VPRN, IPS/IDS, etc.

Expertise in switching technologies and related security: Spanning Tree, LAN security, DHCP snooping, ARP inspection, broadcast and multicast

Expertise in QoS: marking, queuing, shaping, policing, etc.

Expertise in PacketShaping BlueCoat products*

Expertise in WAN Acceleration Riverbed products*

Knowledge of structured cabling for data centre: harness, EMF and fibre trunk*

Wi-Fi

Expertise in designing and implementing Wi-Fi end-to-end solutions

Expertise in LAN/WAN platforms for business/industrial enterprises and service providers

Expertise in marking, queuing, LAN security, PoE / PoE+.

Cellular

Expertise in design and implementation of cellular access end-to-end solutions

Proficient in data cellular technologies (GSM 3G, 4G, LTE)

Proficient in cellular coverage assessment, bandwidth management and end user experience (RSSSI, RSRP, RSRQ, etc.)

Good knowledge of cellular antenna engineering and performance in live environments

Good knowledge of cellular access network dimensioning and deployment guidelines

Mastery of LAN/WAN technologies: complex routing BGP, IS-IS, DMVPN, switching, QoS (marking, queuing)

Good understanding of cellular QoS

Good knowledge of M2M communication and IoT over cellular

Good knowledge of security: zoning, VLAN, VPRN, IPS/IDS, etc.

Telephony

Expertise in voice telephony, VoIP or unified communication technologies

Proficiency in Cisco Telephony and VoIP

Expertise in Cisco communication and collaboration solutions: CUCM, Voice GW, Expressway, IM & presence, IP phones, Jabber and WebEx

Expertise in networking: QoS, switching, security zoning, etc.

Expertise in security: zoning, VLAN, VPRN, IPS/IDS, etc.

Cisco CCNP – Collaboration

Video

Expertise in video surveillance and video management technology and end-to-end solutions

Tools and systems management

Expertise in tapping and aggregation technologies: Network Critical, GigaMon, etc.

Knowledge in reporting and analytics solutions: Tableau, PowerBI, Business Objects, etc.

Basic knowledge of MIBs and object IDs

Knowledge of SNMP v1/v2, v3 and Syslog

Knowledge of NetFlow, IPFIX and IP SLA

Knowledge of MicroFocus (HPe) platforms: NMMi, Omi*

Trained in telecom service delivery and management frameworks: ITIL and TMF*

Automation

Good knowledge of data models and API communications

Understanding of data centre switching, edge routing and cloud networking

Understanding of hypervisor virtualization infrastructure (VMWare)

Radio

Good knowledge of radio technology from VHF to microwave and various modulation schemes including FM, NXDN, DQPSK and QAM

Understanding and use of Microsoft Visio to provide drawings of system interconnections and site layouts

Understanding of FCC rules and regulations

Understanding of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint

Knowledge of test equipment used: Anritsu, service monitors, multimeters, watt meters

FCC GROL license*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

Organizational Impact

Decision Making and Impacts

The Specialist contributes to the technical peer review and quality design review board process, produces and also approves the technical deliverables of peers.  The Specialist acts as an authority in domain(s) of expertise, positions the team on technical matters and commits to deliverables.

The position impacts the quality, performance, sustainability and cost effectiveness of solutions found in the domain(s) of expertise.

 

Level of Interaction/Influence

The Specialist Solution and System identifies, influences, captures and details business requirements and produces technical deliverables for the I&T organization, delivery partners and the business. The Specialist also provides technical guidance, training and coaching to colleagues in own area of expertise.

 

Employees Supervised/Org. Structure

The Specialist does not have direct responsibility over other staff but may supervise work performed by consultants and contractors. 

 

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Expert DevSecOps specialist – CaP
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary

This role is to provide governance within the DevSecOps practice to ensure quality and standards are defined and used by our CN community. The Expert is also responsible for the secure design, development, implementation and support of the platforms and its tools. The Expert define and documents the agreed standards and processes and coaches/mentors the other DevOps specialists to guide the CN team using them. As a DevSecOps Expert you will work collaboratively with the continuous integration and software engineering teams to deliver and operate development & test systems. You will oversee help the automation and streamline product operations and processes; build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations; and troubleshoot / resolve issues in our development, test and production environments and act on occasion in the role of a key systems administrator for various DevOps systems.

 

Main Responsibilities

DevSecOps

  • Manage shared systems and services, docker orchestrator, service registry, secrets management and more.
  • Write production-quality tools to reduce toil for the engineering team and help automate the technical ecosystem to help us scale.
  • Assist other teams to utilize our observability tools and scripts to debug production systems.
  • Shape the technologies used to solve some of our fundamental challenges (e.g. CI/CD, container orchestration, logging, security, etc.)
  • Design and write secure, robust, testable and scalable pipeline template code and consistent design patterns.
  • Evaluate emerging technologies to identify new opportunities, trends and best practices
  • Architect solutions which help projects and multifaceted teams deliver
  • Mentor and coach other devops members within the devsecops practice
  • Administer, support and maintain existing platform components within the DevSecOps practice
  • Evaluate and implement new platform components that can help or improve the teams that use the tools

 

Requirements

Experience

  • Minimum 7-10 years overall work experience in Developement
  • Minimum 5-7 years overall work experience in DevOps and Cloud
  • Experience designing, configuring, and deploying DevOps systems and tools
  • Knowledge of container security, especially Kubernetes, an asset
  • Multi-cloud experience including AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform, an asset
  • Experience with Agile and SAFe methodologies, an asset
  • Experience with the duties required of a SRE, an asset

 

Education/Certification/Designation

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or another relevant field
  • DevOps Certification an asset
  • Azure certification an asset
  • Google certification an asset
  • Security certification: e.g. Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK), Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP), GIAC Cloud Security Automation (GCSA), etc. an asset

 

General Skills and Competencies

  • Ability to define and organise an architecture apparatus in reusable building blocks: patterns, services, components, capability models, etc.
  • Demonstrated capability to understand the implications of complex business operations and how they are linked to technological solutions that provide practical risk mitigation and business enablement
  • Ability to derive requirements from vaguely formulated business needs
  • Ability to interact with a broad cross-section of personnel to explain and enforce security measures
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Detail-oriented self-starter with a high level of commitment and personal motivation
  • Knack for prioritizing tasks and working in a fast-paced environment
  • Work closely with Development Architects, Cloud Architects and other Development/Cloud Specialists. Interact with project teams (functional, development and test leads, project managers and Architects).
  • Position current technology capabilities in the direction of their roadmap and influence Product Owners, Product Managers to adhere to them.
  • Identify and drive opportunities to improve automation for code deployment, management, and visibility of application services
  • Develop tools and framework to automate operational tasks, deployment of machines, services, and applications

 

Technical Skills

  • Strong knowledge of the processes, methodologies, tools and techniques, used for building large information technology systems in private and public clouds
  • Knowledge of standards, regulations and legislation governing Information Security, e.g. OWASP
  • Knowledge of general IT security architecture and technologies including: service-oriented-architectures, mobile technologies including Mobile Device Management (MDM), data-centric design, advanced analytics, AI, Identity and Access Management (IAM) lifecycles, Digital Forensics, End Point Encryption, Encryption Key Management, Database Security, Enterprise Directory Services, IDS, IPS, Next Generation Firewall, Application Firewall, Enterprise Password Vaults, Cloud SaaS /PaaS/IaaS Security, SIEM, etc., an asset
  • Understanding of securing APIs, an asset
  • Knowledge of container security, especially Kubernetes, an asset

 

Additional Skills

  • Fluent in two or more of the following programming languages Python, Go, PowerShell, YAML and Bash
  • Strong knowledge of CI/CD tools (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, etc.)
  • Knowledge of DevOps Security tools (DAST, SATS, IAST) such as Fortify on Demand, SonarQube, BlackDuck.
  • Strong knowledge in cloud computing (Azure, Google)
  • Strong knowledge of Docker and creation/maintenance of dockerfiles
  • Strong knowledge of Kubernetes and creation/maintenance of Kubernetes manifests
  • Experience with Helm and Terraform
  • Experience with Secret Managers (i.e. HashCorp Vault, Azure Key Vault, Google Cloud Key Management, etc.)
  • Experience in designing multistage pipeline flows including CI/CD/CT
  • Experience in administering Linux and Windows systems
  • Familiar with Identity and Access Management (IAM) including RBAC
  • Experience programing using API (RESTful, gRPC, GraphQL, etc.)
  • Familiar with backend server architectures using Service Oriented Architecture or Micro-services design methodologies
  • Good knowledge of Agile project management writing Features, Stories, Tasks and delivering in Sprints and PIs.
  • Ability to accurately estimate efforts of the tasks assigned
  • Proactive, able to plan, address or mitigate technical risk
  • Ability to understand a problem, identify its root and find technical solutions
  • Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel and meet deliverables dates
  • Very good technical documentation skills
  • Strong communication, influencing and presentation skills
  • Leadership skills and ability to influence and guide others on integration and technical matters
  • Proven experience delivering technology projects involving multiple parties
  • Knowledge of IT security principles
  • Ability to clarify requirements and ensure solution meets business needs
  • Strong systems engineering knowledge
  • Ability to navigate within a complex I&T organization
  • Ability to lead in ambiguous situations
  • Strong sense or prioritization for meeting deadlines
  • Strong knowledge how to monitor application and infrastructure
  • Knowledge in logs management, application monitoring, infrastructure monitoring
  • Knowledge of monitoring and logging for containers and orchestrators.
  • Knowledge of networking, security, and protocols
  • Knowledge of SSO, OAuth 2.0 OpenID Connect (OIDC) and SAML 2.0 a plus.
  • IoT experience a plus

 

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Specialist Project management
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

Are you passionate about finding better ways to do things? Can you spot potential problems a mile away? Do you want to be part of CN’s strategy in redefining the railroad through I&T transformation?  If yes, then we may have the role for you!

As a Project Portfolio Specialist, you will drive central planning, dependency management and executive reporting. You will be working across the Office of the CITO and I&T. Working with various teams, you will produce the overall transformation plan including outcomes, milestones, and dependencies. This will provide transparency of progress and help us to make sure we deliver amazing propositions for colleagues and business partners. 

 

Depending on the team, most of our roles offer flexible working and you will work remotely temporarily due to COVID-19.

 

Main Responsibilities

Reporting into the Office of the CITO, the PPO Specialist will be responsible for supporting the organization\'s PPO team, helping to ensure that projects stay on track by tracking the status of transformation deliverables, milestones, and financials.

Project Governance

 ·         Assist with the assessment and analysis of proposed project investments 

 ·         Review Project Change Requests.

 ·         As part of a team understand the detail of projects and provide governance advice to project teams.

 ·         Support project teams in project financial, risk and issue management as directed.

 ·         Monitor the portfolio to ensure compliance to Project Delivery Life Cycle (PDLC- CN Operating Model).

 ·         Review project closeout documentation for accuracy and completion.

 ·         Maintain repository and act as custodian of PPO policies, standards, artifacts, and procedures.

 ·         Support the implementation and maintenance of the PPO quality strategy.

 ·         Support Project Managers where necessary in project initiation, planning, execution, or control.

 ·         Assist in strategic and budgetary planning processes (as needed).

 

Benefits Realization

  •  Support the review of benefits and provide advice to enhance the quality of the benefits
  •  Work with business units to ensure the tracking of project benefits.
  • Collect and analyze data on benefits realization.

 

Portfolio Management

  • Support the production of pipeline data analysis across dependencies, key resource needs, priorities, and benefits.
  • Support project quality management planning, project health checks and lessons learned
  • Work across the portfolio to monitor the delivery of project outcomes.
  • Support the portfolio and project management tools to ensure accurate, relevant, and up-to-date information.
  • Develop Management Reports to provide stakeholders with transparency on the progress and health of projects and the portfolio.
  • Manage project intake process along with any incoming engagement needs.

Continuous Improvement

  • Lead ad hoc studies and investigations.
  • Provide project management guidance to other members of the team.

 

  Project Management Methodology

  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of Operating processes, templates, and systems.
  • Support the Office of the CITO communication and change activities to ensure all stakeholders are informed of the latest PPO processes.
  • Provide introduction, briefing and uplift sessions on governance and project management related processes.
  • Responsible for collecting and consolidating transformation data from a variety of sources for analytics (time, scope, change, budget, benefits, risk, quality) and to produce regular reports and presentations for all levels of governance and key stakeholders.
  • Develop PPO processes and provide training, coaching, oversight, and continuous improvement.
  • Managing the integrated transformation roadmap and associated financials.

Skills

Problem Solving and Judgment: Uses sound judgment and flexibility when recommending appropriate options and solutions; taking a broad scale, long-term view, assessing options and implications; committed to a course of action to accomplish a long-range goal or vision; guides others toward making effective decisions.

Results Orientation: Maintaining operational effectiveness in an environment that contains ambiguity and uncertainty; develops plans and strategies that are ambitious but realistic; and achieves results through others in a positive fashion that balances the interest of CN I&T.

Interpersonal Relationships: Possesses tremendous honesty and integrity; displays strong sense of character and humility; engages in creative approaches to managing team dynamics; values others, focusing on individual uniqueness and preserving an individual’s dignity.

Teamwork: Believing in, supporting, and championing project team members, focuses on creating an environment that strives to meet the voice of the team through the ability to empathize, understand, build rapport, show concern, encourage, engage and connecting with team members; uses sound ethical practices in carrying out operational duties.

Leadership/motivational: Maintains a sense of the big picture and the ability to communicate and mobilize people around a shared vision; engages in a leadership style that is appropriate to the project, person, task, and situation; involving others.

Analysis: Makes credible recommendation based on reports and statistics and ensures that decisions are implemented; reviews decisions considering changed circumstances.

Project Management: Establishes priorities, tasks, and work schedules in advance, maximizes the use of available resources; describes milestones in terms of what is achieved and delivered; allocates decision making authority and task responsibilities to appropriate team members; monitors the progress of plans and ensures that action is taken to resolve delays; anticipates and promptly raises operational or resource issues.

Change Management: Maintains a sense of pace and urgency in self so that change initiatives do not stagnate.

Resilience/assertiveness: Effectively deals with work related problems, pressure, and stress in a professional and positive manner; recovers quickly when faced with obstacles or setbacks.

Communication: Possesses the ability to listen, read body language, ask questions, provide feedback, and generate two-way communication to build trust; engage in a variety of communication styles to articulate goals and objectives; providing timely and relevant information that allows team members to fully participate; effectively deliver information to an audience in a formal setting.

Flexibility: To deliver services effectively, a degree of flexibility is required. The successful candidate may be required to perform work not specifically referred to above.

 

Requirements

Education/Certification/Designation

·       College in technical degree (IT related field)

·       PMI certification (or within 2 years of obtaining OR interest to obtain)

Skills/Knowledge

·       Advanced knowledge of tools and techniques (MS-Project, Excel, PPM tools (Project Portfolio Management tools))

·       Good understanding of project financial management

Experience

·       More than 3 to 5 years as an IT PM, leading small to medium size projects (<1M$)

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

 

CN requires that all employees in Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

 

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: UI Designer, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians.

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

 
About the role

Are you passionate about e-commerce and digital innovation? Are you skilled at translating complex requirements into usable and delightful experiences? Do you keep on top of the latest trends in design and love experimenting with new tools and methodologies? We\'ve got the perfect opportunity for you!

What you’ll do here:

  • Create highly useable, visually stunning, and fun-to-use UI designs for digital applications.
  • Develop clear, functional UI mockups & prototypes.
  • Visualize, propose, and present creative design concepts in a variety of visual styles.
  • Conduct user tests and interviews to validate designs.
  • Interpret a brand book for multiple brands.
  • Contribute to the creation and maintenance of a front-end component library (Design system).
  • Generate UI assets and work with developers to implement to required specifications.
  • Be an advocate for user-centred, data-driven design.
Qualifications

What you bring to the table:

  • At least two years of UI experience.
  • UX experience would be considered an asset.
  • Expertise in usability and user-centred design practices.
  • Mastery of design tools (Sketch, Axure, InVision, Illustrator, etc.).
  • Experience with UX research tools an asset (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.).
  • You love working in a collaborative environment that has a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun.

 

Please include your portfolio in your application.

You are:

  • Creative, analytical, curious and ingenious.
  • A team player that can share and receive constructive feedback.
  • You excel at explaining your ideas to different stakeholders.
  • Deeply passionate about design and quality.
  • Organized and proactive.

 

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office. 

#Hybrid

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

item.title: Senior Security Advisor, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day.

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

Hiring manager: Philippe Audet

THE ROLE:

  • Identify security events that need to be monitored;
  • Advise and support DevOps and development teams in all development phases;
  • Ensure the development, implementation and automation of key risk metrics / indicators to
  • systematically measure and report information risks;
  • Identify and classify the risks then propose mitigations or remedies on the risks;
  • Analyze the risks associated with the various possible solutions and propose a security solution to the
  • operational problem that offers a fair balance between the potential losses and the cost of the
  • solution;
  • Identify gaps in IT compliance control and oversee documentation, implementation and testing for the
  • IT compliance control portfolio for the Lab
  • Monitor the latest industry trends and, where appropriate, proactively suggest the introduction of new
  • security practices and technologies; (automation, implementation, etc.)
  • Perform or coordinate application security tests for project teams;
  • Interpret the results of application security tests (code scanning, application intrusions, etc.);
  • Inform, educate and coach the development teams with regard to the norms, standards, methods and
  • tools of application security development
  • Manage and communicate the various security reports to Intactlab executives
  • Follow up and put processes in place to ensure that various security-related flaws are corrected within
  • the prescribed timeframe
  • Represent the Lab in the various processes that require knowledge of security
Qualifications

What you bring to the table:

  • University degree in information security or equivalent experience;
  • Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in the field of information technology, more specifically in
  • technology and information security;
  • Safety certification would be an asset.
  • Requirements:
  • Strong knowledge of web application security principles and practices;
  • Experience in a DevSecOps - CI / CD environment;
  • Good understanding of common web and cloud application security vulnerabilities and exploitation
  • techniques from sources such as SANS, OWASP Top 10 and Cloud Security Alliance (CSA);
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, in French and English;
  • Sound ethical principles and an understanding of business ethics and information security

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

Right now, we support 100% remote work, if your role permits.  We anticipate that in early 2022, we’ll be moving to a hybrid approach which gives us the best of both worlds – a mix of home and in-office workdays. 
 
Closing Statement

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Intact, our value of Respect is founded on seeing diversity as a strength, being inclusive and fostering collaboration. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected and heard. 

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please advise the Talent Acquisition partner who reaches out about the job opportunity and they will work with you to meet your needs. 

Background Checks

As an employer and publicly traded financial services company, the best interests of our customers, employees and shareholders are important to us.  We want Intact to be a great place to work!  This means that internal and external candidates will be asked to consent to background checks so we can learn more about you. Please note that for positions with access to financial data or funds, your credit must be in good standing.

Internal Candidates

For internal candidates, you can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level. Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants.

Eligibility to Work in Canada

It’s important that you are legally eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer of employment is made.  You may be requested to provide proof of eligibility at that time.

item.title: Manager, Application Architecture, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day.

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role 

High visibility position where you will help create the digital future of Intact worldwide, defining solutions and working with cutting-edge technologies.

Hiring manager: Philippe Audet

Your mandate:

  • Align application architecture practices with new technologies, providing migration solutions to public and internal clouds.
  • Deploy your knowledge to coach the architects in your team so that they can develop portable architectures to different clouds.
  • Influence your partners so that the proposed architectures are implemented according to the best practices of cloud native developments
  • Influence the different roadmaps to realistically integrate changes to existing systems to our target architecture

You will:

  • Develop your team to be engaged and productive while promoting the development of personal and technical skills, as well as collaboration
  • Develop the application architecture and related best practices for all digital lab applications (mobile, web and backend)
  • Collaborate with other managers to ensure that all initiatives have the right people, balancing the needs of the business with each person\'s background and career aspirations.
  • Collaborate with the enterprise and solution architecture to ensure that application architecture decisions are aligned with the directions and vision of the business
  • Ensure our impressive work meets company standards for software engineering, architecture and quality
  • Continuously evolve development practices, tools and processes in order to increase the autonomy and efficiency of teams in collaboration with the software engineering managers of the Lab
  • See to the smooth running of the application architecture delivery and make the necessary corrections when required
  • Collaborate with the different product teams to ensure that the application architecture meets the needs of digital products
  • Master all facets of software development, understand how all the components interact and can impact the performance and quality of the products delivered
  • Communicate the technological vision to team members and ensure its governance
  • Master Agile / Scrum development and ensure that the processes and tools are well suited to it
  • Cultivate change and initiate innovation
  • Stay abreast of new technologies and question the status quo.
Qualifications

You are:

  • Passionate about creating software products.
  • Passionate about software architecture and technological innovations
  • Stimulated by challenges.
  • Creative, curious and resourceful.
  • An agent of change and challenge the status quo
  • Excellent communicator able to explain their ideas to various stakeholders.
  • Visionary with a good understanding of the IT world challenges
  • Diplomat, organized, proactive and a team player.
  • A servant leader who knows how to create an open and participatory environment
  • Comfortable working in a constantly changing technological environment.
  • Bilingual

You bring with you:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Information Technology / Software Engineering or any combination of training and equivalent experience.
  • More than 10 years of experience in the design and development of software applications.
  • Solid management experience including at least 2 years in management and coordination of senior technical people and application architects.
  • A solid experience in the delivery of products in Agile / Scrum mode in Software Engineering.
  • Strong understanding of Java, Mobile, etc., web application technologies.
  • Strong understanding of different types of software architecture (Web, service oriented, distributed, event oriented, CQRS, cloud native etc.)
  • Good knowledge of different front-end technologies (React, vue, angularJS, etc.)
  • Good knowledge of different backend frameworks (kotlyn, nodeJS, Java an asset).
  • Experience with best practices in application security.

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

Right now, we support 100% remote work, if your role permits.  We anticipate that in early 2022, we’ll be moving to a hybrid approach which gives us the best of both worlds – a mix of home and in-office workdays.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

item.title: Python Technical Lead, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 

 
About the role

Your mission:
Lead a team of developers and participate in the design, development, and evolution of microservices, APIs and reusable libraries for the execution of our AI algorithms in mission critical production environment. In an Agile project approach, identify tech debt, help team tackle challenging problems, and iterate fast.

What you’ll do here:

  • Deliver quality products by applying best practices to ensure system security, efficiency, resilience, and sustainability
  • Work with architect, security, and infrastructure team to assure a flexible system design that can evolve over time
  • Guide the team through technical challenges and be their mentor
  • Keep backlog organized together with the Product Owner, by providing technical insights on user requests and tech debt
  • Trouble-shooting issues in production when situation emerges
Qualifications

What you bring to the table:

  • A trusted leader that cares for the team
  • A good communicator who facilitates meaningful conversations proactively
  • A strong problem solver with a get-things-done mindset
  • Curious and interested in cutting edge technology

You have:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in computer engineering, computer science or software engineering, with a minimum of 8 years of significant experience in development of enterprise grade software solutions
  • Proficient in python language and a good understanding of programming languages such as Java
  • Good understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithm design techniques 
  • Experienced with machine learning libraries and tools such as Scikit-learn, NumPy, MLflow, etc.
  • Experienced with software engineering life cycle and agile methodologies.
  • Experienced in developing containerized applications with Docker, Kubernetes, etc.
  • Experienced with modern DevOps tools such as Gitlab CI/CD, ELK stack and Grafana

Assets:

  • Familiarity with machine learning and data processing frameworks such as XGBoost, TensorFlow or Spark
  • Familiarity with data storage and warehousing technologies such as Snowflake, MongoDB, S3
  • Familiarity with AWS technologies such as Kinesis, Lambda and CloudWatch
  • Familiarity with event streaming or message queue systems such as Kafka
     

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist (Toronto), Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. 

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day.

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark? 
About the role

Workplace: Toronto (700 University av.)

As a Senior Data Scientist with the Intact Lab, you\'ll thrive as a technical expert, thought leader, and teacher with our diverse and highly skilled team. You\'ll leverage your expertise and knowledge of trends in analytics to make recommendations that solve complex problems and promote best practices across the organization. With the support of a passionate team, you will help create real value for both customers and teammates. Enjoy a work experience that promotes work-life balance with one of North America’s recognized best employers.

WHAT YOU’LL DO HERE

  • Develop innovative solutions for trend recognition using machine learning and advanced statistics
  • Transform complex databases into relevant conclusions and recommendations
  • Keep pace with new approaches and trends and use them in your own solutions
  • Help maintain our data mining tools and platforms
  • Make actionable recommendations based on the findings
  • Work with other departments to promote the adoption of analytical principles within the organization
  • Validate the quality of the analytical approach and project outputs of the other team members
Qualifications

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE

  • Your Master’s degree in a relevant discipline (mathematics, science, engineering, operational research, economics, statistics, AI, computer science or a related field)
  • Your 5 years of experience in the field of advanced statistics, data mining and text mining
  • A multi-platform production experience with the following commercial and open-source data mining frameworks:
  • Open-source frameworks: R, Python, GitHub
  • Expert-level understanding of the underlying theory of machine learning
  • Expert-level understanding in either computer image analysis, natural language processing or artificial intelligence
  • Your enthusiasm for teamwork
  • Your ability to focus on vaguely defined issues requiring the application of a creative approach
  • Your strong communication, time management and work organization skills

Here, innovation is everyone’s job and you’ll have the opportunity to make your mark.  In return, we promise you the support, opportunities and flexibility to do you life’s best work and be your best self.

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work (Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Aon Platinum Best Employers, LinkedIn Top Company, Glassdoor Best Place to Work & Top CEO, Indeed Top-Rated Workplaces)
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • Flexibility in how and where you work
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package 
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A casual ‘dress for your day’ culture that encourages you to be yourself
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office. 

#hybrid
Closing Statement

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Intact, our value of Respect is founded on seeing diversity as a strength, being inclusive and fostering collaboration. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected and heard. 

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please advise the Talent Acquisition partner who reaches out about the job opportunity and they will work with you to meet your needs. 

Background Checks

As an employer and publicly traded financial services company, the best interests of our customers, employees and shareholders are important to us.  We want Intact to be a great place to work!  This means that internal and external candidates will be asked to consent to background checks so we can learn more about you. Please note that for positions with access to financial data or funds, your credit must be in good standing.

Internal Candidates

For internal candidates, you can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level. Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants.

Eligibility to Work in Canada

It’s important that you are legally eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer of employment is made.  You may be requested to provide proof of eligibility at that time.
Referral Bonus

This role is eligible for employee referral bonus. #myReferrals3000

item.title: UI Designer (System designer), Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians.

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day.

Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?
About the role

Are you passionate about design systems? Stacking components, identifying standards,  guidelines, educating users and letting your work live in a multi-brand digital product ecosystem. White labelling, design token and pixel perfect are some words that fuel your brain? We\'ve got the ideal opportunity for you!

As a UI Designer (System designer), you play a critical role in the mission of  iceberg, Intact\'s design system. You will report to the Design System Studio Manager and collaborate with our UI designers, UX developers, and writers. You\'ll help spruce up our multi-brand libraries, grow the design system culture, improve our style guides and documentation.

WORKPLACE: Montreal (2020, Robert-Bourassa), Toronto (700, University) or Anjou (7101, Jean-Talon E)

What you’ll do here:

  • Interpret brand books and build elements that can be applied for 5+ brands in a white labelling methodology.
  • Document in-depth the designs and rules of use for the components and elements in the design system.
  • Ensure the maintenance, continuous improvement and the justification of the decisions taken vis-à-vis the design system.
  • Promote the updates and enhancements of the design system during weekly presentations, creative meetings, and more.
  • Conduct user tests and interviews to validate new elements.
  • Be an advocate for the design system and participate in design communities within the Lab.
Qualifications

What you bring to the table:

  • At least seven years of experience linked to UI design.
  • Expertise in building and maintaining design systems.
  • Mastery of design tools, Figma (primary tool), but may need to use others (Axure, Adobe products, etc.).
  • Experience with UX research tools an asset (usertesting.com).
  • You love working in a collaborative environment that has a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun.
  • You have a strong ability to think technically, with knowledge of patterns for responsive
  • design and native mobile.

You are

  • Creative, analytical and love when elements are well aligned in a file.
  • A team player that can share and receive constructive feedback.
  • You understand why it’s important to name each layer of your files
  • Excel at explaining your ideas to different stakeholders.
  • Deeply passionate about design and quality.
  • Organized and proactive.

You\'re the ideal candidate if:

  • You\'ve helped create a design system and contributed to improving DesignOps.
  • You excel at creating/evolving enterprise UI design but understand that you’re not an Art Director.
  • You have a solid working knowledge of accessibility guidelines (WCAG).
  • You understand front-end code and the limitations of front-end technology. You can demonstrate this by understanding the needs of the developers you\'ve worked with previously.
  • You\'ve worked for a company that builds and maintains digital products.
  • You\'re humble and able to freely discuss your strengths and weaknesses (and those of others), but always in a kind, professional, and appropriate way.
  • Our values of integrity, respect, customer-driven, excellence and generosity resonate with you.
  • You enjoy collaborating with a cross-functional team.

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.
